pragma Inform6 "$MAX_CLASSES=200"

#Primitives:
primitive !plus val val -> val
primitive !minus val val -> val
primitive !unaryminus val -> val
primitive !times val val -> val
primitive !divide val val -> val
primitive !modulo val val -> val
primitive !bitwiseand val val -> val
primitive !bitwiseor val val -> val
primitive !bitwisenot val -> val
primitive !sequential val val -> val
primitive !ternarysequential val val val -> val
primitive !random val -> val
primitive !store ref val -> val
primitive !preincrement ref -> val
primitive !postincrement ref -> val
primitive !predecrement ref -> val
primitive !postdecrement ref -> val
primitive !setbit ref val -> void
primitive !clearbit ref val -> void
primitive !push val -> void
primitive !pull ref -> void
primitive !lookup val val -> val
primitive !lookupbyte val val -> val
primitive !propertyarray val val val -> val
primitive !propertylength val val val -> val
primitive !propertyexists val val val -> val
primitive !propertyvalue val val val -> val
primitive !move val val -> void
primitive !remove val -> void
primitive !child val -> val
primitive !children val -> val
primitive !sibling val -> val
primitive !parent val -> val
primitive !metaclass val -> val
primitive !not val -> val
primitive !and val val -> val
primitive !or val val -> val
primitive !eq val val -> val
primitive !ne val val -> val
primitive !gt val val -> val
primitive !ge val val -> val
primitive !lt val val -> val
primitive !le val val -> val
primitive !ofclass val val -> val
primitive !in val val -> val
primitive !notin val val -> val
primitive !alternative val val -> val
primitive !enableprinting void -> void
primitive !font val -> void
primitive !style val -> void
primitive !print val -> void
primitive !printnl void -> void
primitive !printchar val -> void
primitive !printobj val -> void
primitive !printnumber val -> void
primitive !printdword val -> void
primitive !printstring val -> void
primitive !box val -> void
primitive !spaces val -> void
primitive !if val code -> void
primitive !ifdebug code -> void
primitive !ifstrict code -> void
primitive !ifelse val code code -> void
primitive !while val code -> void
primitive !do val code -> void
primitive !for val val val code -> void
primitive !objectloop ref val val code -> void
primitive !objectloopx ref val code -> void
primitive !break void -> void
primitive !continue void -> void
primitive !switch val code -> void
primitive !case val code -> void
primitive !alternativecase val val -> val
primitive !default code -> void
primitive !return val -> void
primitive !jump lab -> void
primitive !quit void -> void
primitive !restore lab -> void
primitive !indirect0v val -> void
primitive !indirect1v val val -> void
primitive !indirect2v val val val -> void
primitive !indirect3v val val val val -> void
primitive !indirect4v val val val val val -> void
primitive !indirect5v val val val val val val -> void

primitive !indirect2 val val val -> val
primitive !indirect3 val val val val -> val
primitive !indirect4 val val val val val -> val
primitive !indirect5 val val val val val val -> val

primitive !message1 val val val -> val
primitive !message2 val val val val -> val
primitive !message3 val val val val val -> val
primitive !externalcall val val -> val
package main _plain
	package generic _module
		package conjugations _submodule
			constant (int32) CV_POS = -1
			constant (int32) CV_NEG = -2
			constant (int32) CV_MODAL = -3
			constant (int32) CV_MEANING = -4
			package verb1 _verb
				constant (text) ^name = "to be"
				constant (text) ^infinitive = "be"
				constant (int32) ^meaningless = 0
				constant (text) ^meaning = "equality "
				constant (text) ^present = "A is B; A are B"
				constant (text) ^past = "A was B; A were B"
				constant (text) ^present_perfect = "A has  been B; A have  been B"
				constant (text) ^past_perfect = "A had  been B"
				constant (int32) ^at = -1
				package conjugation_fn _function
					package call _code __translation="ConjugateVerb1"
						local fn
						local vp
						local t
						local modal_to
						code
							inv !switch
								val fn
								code
									inv !case
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 1
										code
											inv !print
												val "be"
									inv !case
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 2
										code
											inv !print
												val "been"
									inv !case
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 3
										code
											inv !print
												val "being"
									inv !case
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MODAL
										code
											inv !return
												val 0
									inv !case
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MEANING
										code
											inv !return
												val /main/generic/relations/relation1/Rel_Record1
									inv !case
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_POS
										code
											inv !switch
												val t
												code
													inv !case
														val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 1
														code
															inv !switch
																val vp
																code
																	inv !case
																		val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 1
																		code
																			inv !print
																				val "am"
																	inv !case
																		val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 4
																		code
																			inv !print
																				val "are"
																	inv !case
																		val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 2
																		code
																			inv !print
																				val "are"
																	inv !case
																		val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 5
																		code
																			inv !print
																				val "are"
																	inv !case
																		val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 3
																		code
																			inv !print
																				val "is"
																	inv !case
																		val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 6
																		code
																			inv !print
																				val "are"
													inv !case
														val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 2
														code
															inv !switch
																val vp
																code
																	inv !case
																		val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 1
																		code
																			inv !print
																				val "was"
																	inv !case
																		val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 4
																		code
																			inv !print
																				val "were"
																	inv !case
																		val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 2
																		code
																			inv !print
																				val "were"
																	inv !case
																		val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 5
																		code
																			inv !print
																				val "were"
																	inv !case
																		val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 3
																		code
																			inv !print
																				val "was"
																	inv !case
																		val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 6
																		code
																			inv !print
																				val "were"
													inv !case
														val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 3
														code
															inv !ifelse
																inv !eq
																	val vp
																	val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 3
																code
																	inv !print
																		val "has been"
																code
																	inv !print
																		val "have been"
													inv !case
														val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 4
														code
															inv !print
																val "had been"
													inv !case
														val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 5
														code
															inv !print
																val "will be"
									inv !case
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_NEG
										code
											inv !switch
												val t
												code
													inv !case

				package form1 _verb_form
					package form_fn _function
						package call _code __translation="call_U1"
							local fn
							local vp
							local t
							local modal_to
							code
								#be
								inv !store
									ref t
									inv /main/generic/conjugations/verb1/conjugation_fn/call
										val fn
										val vp
										val t
										val modal_to
								inv !if
									inv !eq
										val fn
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MODAL
									code
										inv !return
											val t
								inv !if
									inv !eq
										val fn
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MEANING
									code
										inv !return
											val /main/generic/relations/relation1/Rel_Record1
					constant ^verb_value = /main/generic/conjugations/verb1/form1/form_fn/call
					constant (int32) ^verb_sorting = 0
			package modal_verb1 _modal_verb
				constant (text) ^name = "has (modal)"
				constant (text) ^infinitive = "auxiliary-have"
				constant (int32) ^at = -1
				package conjugation_fn _function
					package call _code __translation="ConjugateModalVerb1"
						local fn
						local vp
						local t
						local modal_to

											inv !print

									inv !case
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MODAL
										code
											inv !return
												val 0
									inv !case
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MEANING
										code
											inv !return

									inv !case
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_POS

											inv !switch
												val t
												code
													inv !case

			package verb2 _verb
				constant (text) ^name = "to mean"
				constant (text) ^infinitive = "mean"
				constant (int32) ^meaningless = 0
				constant (text) ^meaning = "meaning "
				constant (text) ^present = "A means B; A mean B"

				constant (text) ^present_perfect = "A has  meant B; A have  meant B"
				constant (text) ^past_perfect = "A had  meant B"
				constant (int32) ^at = -1

			package verb3 _verb
				constant (text) ^name = "to do"
				constant (text) ^infinitive = "do"
				constant (int32) ^meaningless = 0
				constant (text) ^present = "A does B; A do B"
				constant (text) ^past = "A did B"
				constant (text) ^present_perfect = "A has  done B; A have  done B"
				constant (text) ^past_perfect = "A had  done B"
				constant (int32) ^at = -1
				package conjugation_fn _function
					package call _code __translation="ConjugateVerb3"
						local fn
						local vp
						local t
						local modal_to
						code
							inv !switch
								val fn
								code
									inv !case
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 1

										code
											inv !print

									inv !case
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MODAL
										code
											inv !return
												val 0
									inv !case
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MEANING
										code
											inv !return
												val /main/generic/relations/relation1/Rel_Record1
									inv !case
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_POS
										code
											inv !switch

												code
													inv !case

														code
															inv !ifelse

																	val vp

				package ranger_fn _function
					package call _code __translation="call_U30"
						local a
						local b
						code
							inv !if
								inv !and
									inv !eq
										val a
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 0
									inv !eq
										val b
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 0
								code
									inv !return
										inv !random
											val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 0
							inv !if
								inv !eq
									val a
									val b
								code
									inv !return
										val b
							inv !if
								inv !gt
									val a
									val b
								code
									inv !return
										inv !plus
											val b
											inv !modulo
												inv !random
													val /main/architectural/MAX_POSITIVE_NUMBER
												inv !plus
													inv !minus
														val a
														val b
													val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 1
							inv !return
								inv !plus
									val a
									inv !modulo
										inv !random
											val /main/architectural/MAX_POSITIVE_NUMBER
										inv !plus
											inv !minus
												val b
												val a
											val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 1

			package adjective1 _adjective
				package adjective_task1 _adjective_task
					package task_fn _function
						package call _code __translation="call_U34"
							#:number
							local (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) t_0
							code
								#meaning of "even"
								inv !if
									val (/main/generic/kinds/kind4/K_truth_state) 1
									code
										inv !return
											inv !eq
												inv /main/BasicInformKit/functions/IntegerRemainder_fn/IntegerRemainder
													val t_0
													val 2
												val 0
								inv !return
									val 0
				constant (text) ^text = "even"

			package modal_verb3 _modal_verb
				constant (text) ^name = "is (modal)"
				constant (text) ^infinitive = "be"
				constant (int32) ^at = 14922
				package conjugation_fn _function
					package call _code __translation="ConjugateModalVerb4"
						local fn
						local vp
						local t
						local modal_to
						code
							inv !switch
								val fn
								code
									inv !case
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 1
										code

										code

			package verb1 _verb
				constant (text) ^name = "to imply"
				constant (text) ^infinitive = "imply"
				constant (int32) ^meaningless = 0
				constant (text) ^meaning = "meaning "
				constant (text) ^present = "A implies B; A imply B"
				constant (text) ^past = "A implied B"
				constant (text) ^present_perfect = "A has  implied B; A have  implied B"
				constant (text) ^past_perfect = "A had  implied B"
				constant (int32) ^at = 15042
				package conjugation_fn _function
					package call _code __translation="ConjugateVerb4"
						local fn
						local vp
						local t
						local modal_to
						code
							inv !switch
								val fn
								code
									inv !case
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 1

											inv !print

											inv !print

										code
											inv !print

										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MODAL
										code
											inv !return

									inv !case
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MEANING
										code

				package form1 _verb_form
					package form_fn _function
						package call _code __translation="call_U124"
							local fn
							local vp
							local t
							local modal_to
							code
								#imply
								inv !store
									ref t
									inv /main/basic_inform_by_graham_nelson/conjugations/verb1/conjugation_fn/call
										val fn
										val vp
										val t
										val modal_to
								inv !if
									inv !eq
										val fn
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MODAL
									code
										inv !return
											val t
								inv !if
									inv !eq
										val fn
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MEANING
									code
										inv !return
											val /main/generic/relations/relation1/Rel_Record1
					constant ^verb_value = /main/basic_inform_by_graham_nelson/conjugations/verb1/form1/form_fn/call
					constant (int32) ^verb_sorting = 4
			package modal_verb11 _modal_verb
				constant (text) ^name = "implies (modal)"

				constant (int32) ^at = 15052
				package conjugation_fn _function
					package call _code __translation="ConjugateModalVerb12"
						local fn
						local vp
						local t
						local modal_to
						code
							inv !switch
								val fn
								code
									inv !case
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 1

									inv !case
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 2
										code
											inv !print
												val "implied"

			package verb2 _verb
				constant (text) ^name = "to be able to be"
				constant (text) ^infinitive = "be able to be"
				constant (int32) ^meaningless = 0
				constant (text) ^present = "A can  be B; B can  be  been  by A"
				constant (text) ^past = "A could  be B; B could  be  been  by A"
				constant (text) ^present_perfect = "A has  been  able  to  be B; A have  been  able  to  be B; B has  been  able  to  be  been  by A; B have  been  able  to  be  been  by A"

				package form1 _verb_form

						package call _code __translation="call_U125"

							local vp
							local t

									ref t
									inv /main/basic_inform_by_graham_nelson/conjugations/verb2/conjugation_fn/call

										val t

		package conjugations _submodule
			package modal_verb1 _modal_verb
				constant (text) ^name = "can (modal)"
				constant (text) ^infinitive = "be able to"
				constant (int32) ^at = 25178
				package conjugation_fn _function
					package call _code __translation="ConjugateModalVerb25"
						local fn
						local vp
						local t
						local modal_to
						code
							inv !switch
								val fn
								code
									inv !case
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 1
										code
											inv !print
												val "be able to"
									inv !case
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 2
										code
											inv !print
												val "been able to"
									inv !case
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 3
										code
											inv !print
												val "being able to"
									inv !case
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MODAL
										code
											inv !return
												val 1
									inv !case
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MEANING
										code
											inv !return
												val /main/generic/relations/relation1/Rel_Record1
									inv !case
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_POS
										code
											inv !switch
												val t
												code
													inv !case
														val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 1
														code
															inv !switch
																val vp
																code
																	inv !case
																		val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 1
																		code
																			inv !print
																				val "can"
																			inv !if
																				val modal_to
																				code

			package verb1 _verb
				constant (text) ^name = "to could"
				constant (text) ^infinitive = "could"
				constant (int32) ^meaningless = 0
				constant (text) ^meaning = "&nbsp;<a href='inform://Extensions/Extensions/Graham%20Nelson/English%20Language.html' title=\"English Language by Graham Nelson\" style=\"text-decoration: none\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/Revealext.png></a>"
				constant (text) ^present = "A could B"
				constant (text) ^present_perfect = "A could  have B"
				constant (int32) ^at = 25186
				package conjugation_fn _function
					package call _code __translation="ConjugateVerb17"
						local fn
						local vp
						local t
						local modal_to
						code
							inv !switch
								val fn
								code
									inv !case
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 1
										code
											inv !print
												val "could"
									inv !case
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 2
										code
											inv !print
												val "coulded"
									inv !case
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 3
										code
											inv !print
												val "coulding"
									inv !case
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MODAL
										code
											inv !return
												val 1
									inv !case
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MEANING
										code
											inv !return
												val /main/generic/relations/relation1/Rel_Record1
									inv !case
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_POS

												val t

				package form1 _verb_form
					package form_fn _function
						package call _code __translation="call_U159"
							local fn
							local vp
							local t
							local modal_to
							code
								#could
								inv !store
									ref t
									inv /main/english_language_by_graham_nelson/conjugations/verb1/conjugation_fn/call
										val fn
										val vp
										val t
										val modal_to
								inv !if
									inv !eq
										val fn
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MODAL
									code
										inv !return
											val t
								inv !if
									inv !eq
										val fn
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MEANING
									code
										inv !return
											val /main/generic/relations/relation1/Rel_Record1
					constant ^verb_value = /main/english_language_by_graham_nelson/conjugations/verb1/form1/form_fn/call
					constant (int32) ^verb_sorting = 61
			package verb2 _verb
				constant (text) ^name = "to may"
				constant (text) ^infinitive = "may"
				constant (int32) ^meaningless = 0
				constant (text) ^meaning = "&nbsp;<a href='inform://Extensions/Extensions/Graham%20Nelson/English%20Language.html' title=\"English Language by Graham Nelson\" style=\"text-decoration: none\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/Revealext.png></a>"
				constant (text) ^present = "A may B"
				constant (text) ^present_perfect = "A may  have B"
				constant (int32) ^at = 25192
				package conjugation_fn _function
					package call _code __translation="ConjugateVerb18"

				package form1 _verb_form
					package form_fn _function
						package call _code __translation="call_U160"
							local fn
							local vp
							local t
							local modal_to
							code
								#may
								inv !store
									ref t
									inv /main/english_language_by_graham_nelson/conjugations/verb2/conjugation_fn/call
										val fn
										val vp
										val t
										val modal_to
								inv !if
									inv !eq
										val fn
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MODAL
									code
										inv !return
											val t
								inv !if
									inv !eq
										val fn
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MEANING
									code
										inv !return
											val /main/generic/relations/relation1/Rel_Record1
					constant ^verb_value = /main/english_language_by_graham_nelson/conjugations/verb2/form1/form_fn/call
					constant (int32) ^verb_sorting = 63
			package verb3 _verb
				constant (text) ^name = "to might"
				constant (text) ^infinitive = "might"
				constant (int32) ^meaningless = 0
				constant (text) ^meaning = "&nbsp;<a href='inform://Extensions/Extensions/Graham%20Nelson/English%20Language.html' title=\"English Language by Graham Nelson\" style=\"text-decoration: none\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/Revealext.png></a>"
				constant (text) ^present = "A might B"
				constant (text) ^present_perfect = "A might  have B"
				constant (int32) ^at = 25198
				package conjugation_fn _function
					package call _code __translation="ConjugateVerb19"
						local fn
						local vp
						local t
						local modal_to
						code
							inv !switch
								val fn
								code
									inv !case

				package form1 _verb_form
					package form_fn _function
						package call _code __translation="call_U161"
							local fn
							local vp
							local t
							local modal_to
							code
								#might
								inv !store
									ref t
									inv /main/english_language_by_graham_nelson/conjugations/verb3/conjugation_fn/call
										val fn
										val vp
										val t
										val modal_to
								inv !if
									inv !eq
										val fn
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MODAL
									code
										inv !return
											val t
								inv !if
									inv !eq
										val fn
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MEANING
									code
										inv !return
											val /main/generic/relations/relation1/Rel_Record1
					constant ^verb_value = /main/english_language_by_graham_nelson/conjugations/verb3/form1/form_fn/call
					constant (int32) ^verb_sorting = 65
			package verb4 _verb
				constant (text) ^name = "to must"
				constant (text) ^infinitive = "must"
				constant (int32) ^meaningless = 0
				constant (text) ^meaning = "&nbsp;<a href='inform://Extensions/Extensions/Graham%20Nelson/English%20Language.html' title=\"English Language by Graham Nelson\" style=\"text-decoration: none\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/Revealext.png></a>"
				constant (text) ^present = "A must B"
				constant (text) ^present_perfect = "A must  have B"
				constant (int32) ^at = 25204
				package conjugation_fn _function
					package call _code __translation="ConjugateVerb20"
						local fn
						local vp

				package form1 _verb_form
					package form_fn _function
						package call _code __translation="call_U162"
							local fn
							local vp
							local t
							local modal_to
							code
								#must
								inv !store
									ref t
									inv /main/english_language_by_graham_nelson/conjugations/verb4/conjugation_fn/call
										val fn
										val vp
										val t
										val modal_to
								inv !if
									inv !eq
										val fn
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MODAL
									code
										inv !return
											val t
								inv !if
									inv !eq
										val fn
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MEANING
									code
										inv !return
											val /main/generic/relations/relation1/Rel_Record1
					constant ^verb_value = /main/english_language_by_graham_nelson/conjugations/verb4/form1/form_fn/call
					constant (int32) ^verb_sorting = 67
			package verb5 _verb
				constant (text) ^name = "to should"
				constant (text) ^infinitive = "should"
				constant (int32) ^meaningless = 0
				constant (text) ^meaning = "&nbsp;<a href='inform://Extensions/Extensions/Graham%20Nelson/English%20Language.html' title=\"English Language by Graham Nelson\" style=\"text-decoration: none\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/Revealext.png></a>"
				constant (text) ^present = "A should B"
				constant (text) ^present_perfect = "A should  have B"
				constant (int32) ^at = 25210

				package form1 _verb_form
					package form_fn _function
						package call _code __translation="call_U163"
							local fn
							local vp
							local t
							local modal_to
							code
								#should
								inv !store
									ref t
									inv /main/english_language_by_graham_nelson/conjugations/verb5/conjugation_fn/call
										val fn
										val vp
										val t
										val modal_to
								inv !if
									inv !eq
										val fn
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MODAL
									code
										inv !return
											val t
								inv !if
									inv !eq
										val fn
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MEANING
									code
										inv !return
											val /main/generic/relations/relation1/Rel_Record1
					constant ^verb_value = /main/english_language_by_graham_nelson/conjugations/verb5/form1/form_fn/call
					constant (int32) ^verb_sorting = 69
			package verb6 _verb
				constant (text) ^name = "to would"
				constant (text) ^infinitive = "would"
				constant (int32) ^meaningless = 0
				constant (text) ^meaning = "&nbsp;<a href='inform://Extensions/Extensions/Graham%20Nelson/English%20Language.html' title=\"English Language by Graham Nelson\" style=\"text-decoration: none\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/Revealext.png></a>"
				constant (text) ^present = "A would B"
				constant (text) ^present_perfect = "A would  have B"
				constant (int32) ^at = 25216
				package conjugation_fn _function
					package call _code __translation="ConjugateVerb22"
						local fn
						local vp
						local t
						local modal_to
						code
							inv !switch
								val fn
								code
									inv !case
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 1

				package form1 _verb_form
					package form_fn _function
						package call _code __translation="call_U164"
							local fn
							local vp
							local t
							local modal_to
							code
								#would
								inv !store
									ref t
									inv /main/english_language_by_graham_nelson/conjugations/verb6/conjugation_fn/call
										val fn
										val vp
										val t
										val modal_to
								inv !if
									inv !eq
										val fn
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MODAL
									code
										inv !return
											val t
								inv !if
									inv !eq
										val fn
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MEANING
									code
										inv !return
											val /main/generic/relations/relation1/Rel_Record1
					constant ^verb_value = /main/english_language_by_graham_nelson/conjugations/verb6/form1/form_fn/call
					constant (int32) ^verb_sorting = 71
			package verb7 _verb
				constant (text) ^name = "to 're"
				constant (text) ^infinitive = "'re"
				constant (int32) ^meaningless = 0
				constant (text) ^meaning = "&nbsp;<a href='inform://Extensions/Extensions/Graham%20Nelson/English%20Language.html' title=\"English Language by Graham Nelson\" style=\"text-decoration: none\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/Revealext.png></a>"
				constant (text) ^present = "A 's B; A 're B"
				constant (text) ^past = "A was B; A were B"
				constant (text) ^present_perfect = "A 's  been B; A 've  been B"
				constant (text) ^past_perfect = "A 'd  been B"
				constant (int32) ^at = 25223
				package conjugation_fn _function
					package call _code __translation="ConjugateVerb23"
						local fn
						local vp
						local t
						local modal_to
						code
							inv !switch
								val fn
								code
									inv !case
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 1
										code
											inv !print
												val "'re"
									inv !case
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 2
										code
											inv !print
												val " been"
									inv !case
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 3
										code
											inv !print
												val " being"
									inv !case
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MODAL
										code
											inv !return
												val 0
									inv !case
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MEANING
										code
											inv !return
												val /main/generic/relations/relation1/Rel_Record1
									inv !case
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_POS
										code
											inv !switch
												val t
												code
													inv !case
														val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 1
														code
															inv !switch
																val vp
																code
																	inv !case
																		val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 1
																		code
																			inv !print
																				val "'m"
																	inv !case
																		val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 4
																		code
																			inv !print
																				val "'re"
																	inv !case
																		val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 2
																		code
																			inv !print
																				val "'re"
																	inv !case
																		val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 5
																		code
																			inv !print
																				val "'re"
																	inv !case
																		val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 3
																		code
																			inv !print
																				val "'s"
																	inv !case
																		val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 6
																		code
																			inv !print
																				val "'re"
													inv !case
														val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 2
														code
															inv !switch
																val vp
																code
																	inv !case
																		val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 1
																		code
																			inv !print
																				val " was"
																	inv !case
																		val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 4
																		code
																			inv !print
																				val " were"
																	inv !case
																		val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 2
																		code
																			inv !print
																				val " were"
																	inv !case
																		val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 5
																		code
																			inv !print
																				val " were"
																	inv !case
																		val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 3
																		code
																			inv !print
																				val " was"
																	inv !case
																		val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 6
																		code
																			inv !print
																				val " were"
													inv !case
														val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 3
														code
															inv !ifelse
																inv !eq
																	val vp
																	val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 3
																code
																	inv !print
																		val "'s been"
																code
																	inv !print
																		val "'ve been"
													inv !case
														val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 4
														code
															inv !print

			package verb11 _verb
				constant (text) ^name = "to haven't"
				constant (text) ^infinitive = "haven't"
				constant (int32) ^meaningless = 0
				constant (text) ^meaning = "&nbsp;<a href='inform://Extensions/Extensions/Graham%20Nelson/English%20Language.html' title=\"English Language by Graham Nelson\" style=\"text-decoration: none\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/Revealext.png></a>"

			package verb12 _verb
				constant (text) ^name = "to don't"
				constant (text) ^infinitive = "don't"
				constant (int32) ^meaningless = 0
				constant (text) ^meaning = "&nbsp;<a href='inform://Extensions/Extensions/Graham%20Nelson/English%20Language.html' title=\"English Language by Graham Nelson\" style=\"text-decoration: none\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/Revealext.png></a>"
				constant (text) ^present = "A doesn't B; A don't B"
				constant (text) ^present_perfect = "A didn't B"
				constant (int32) ^at = 25247
				package conjugation_fn _function
					package call _code __translation="ConjugateVerb28"
						local fn
						local vp
						local t
						local modal_to
						code
							inv !switch
								val fn
								code
									inv !case
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 1
										code
											inv !print
												val "don't"
									inv !case
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 2
										code
											inv !print
												val "don'ted"
									inv !case
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 3
										code
											inv !print
												val "don'ting"
									inv !case
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MODAL
										code
											inv !return
												val 1
									inv !case
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MEANING
										code
											inv !return
												val /main/generic/relations/relation1/Rel_Record1
									inv !case
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_POS
										code
											inv !switch
												val t
												code
													inv !case
														val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 1
														code
															inv !switch
																val vp
																code
																	inv !case
																		val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 1
																		code
																			inv !print
																				val "don't"
																			inv !if
																				val modal_to
																				code
																					inv !print
																						val " "
																					inv !indirect1v
																						val modal_to
																						val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 1
																	inv !case
																		val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 4
																		code
																			inv !print
																				val "don't"
																			inv !if
																				val modal_to
																				code
																					inv !print
																						val " "
																					inv !indirect1v
																						val modal_to
																						val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 1

																		val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 2
																		code
																			inv !print

			package modal_verb2 _modal_verb
				constant (text) ^name = "hasn't (modal)"
				constant (text) ^infinitive = "haven't"
				constant (int32) ^at = 25253
				package conjugation_fn _function
					package call _code __translation="ConjugateModalVerb26"
						local fn
						local vp
						local t
						local modal_to
						code
							inv !switch
								val fn
								code
									inv !case
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 1

											inv !print
												val "haven't"

										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 2

											inv !print

										code
											inv !return
												val 1

										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MEANING
										code
											inv !return
												val /main/generic/relations/relation1/Rel_Record1

			package verb13 _verb
				constant (text) ^name = "to mustn't"
				constant (text) ^infinitive = "mustn't"
				constant (int32) ^meaningless = 0
				constant (text) ^meaning = "&nbsp;<a href='inform://Extensions/Extensions/Graham%20Nelson/English%20Language.html' title=\"English Language by Graham Nelson\" style=\"text-decoration: none\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/Revealext.png></a>"

			package verb14 _verb
				constant (text) ^name = "to mightn't"
				constant (text) ^infinitive = "mightn't"
				constant (int32) ^meaningless = 0
				constant (text) ^meaning = "&nbsp;<a href='inform://Extensions/Extensions/Graham%20Nelson/English%20Language.html' title=\"English Language by Graham Nelson\" style=\"text-decoration: none\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/Revealext.png></a>"
				constant (text) ^present = "A mightn't B"
				constant (text) ^present_perfect = "A mightn't  have B"
				constant (int32) ^at = 25265
				package conjugation_fn _function
					package call _code __translation="ConjugateVerb30"
						local fn
						local vp
						local t
						local modal_to
						code
							inv !switch
								val fn
								code
									inv !case
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 1
										code

												val "mightn't"

			package verb15 _verb
				constant (text) ^name = "to mayn't"
				constant (text) ^infinitive = "mayn't"
				constant (int32) ^meaningless = 0
				constant (text) ^meaning = "&nbsp;<a href='inform://Extensions/Extensions/Graham%20Nelson/English%20Language.html' title=\"English Language by Graham Nelson\" style=\"text-decoration: none\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/Revealext.png></a>"
				constant (text) ^present = "A mayn't B"
				constant (text) ^present_perfect = "A mayn't  have B"
				constant (int32) ^at = 25271
				package conjugation_fn _function
					package call _code __translation="ConjugateVerb31"
						local fn
						local vp
						local t
						local modal_to
						code
							inv !switch
								val fn
								code
									inv !case
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 1
										code
											inv !print
												val "mayn't"
									inv !case
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 2
										code
											inv !print
												val "mayn'ted"
									inv !case
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 3
										code
											inv !print
												val "mayn'ting"
									inv !case
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MODAL
										code
											inv !return
												val 1
									inv !case
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MEANING
										code
											inv !return
												val /main/generic/relations/relation1/Rel_Record1
									inv !case
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_POS
										code
											inv !switch
												val t
												code
													inv !case
														val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 1

			package verb16 _verb
				constant (text) ^name = "to wouldn't"
				constant (text) ^infinitive = "wouldn't"
				constant (int32) ^meaningless = 0
				constant (text) ^meaning = "&nbsp;<a href='inform://Extensions/Extensions/Graham%20Nelson/English%20Language.html' title=\"English Language by Graham Nelson\" style=\"text-decoration: none\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/Revealext.png></a>"

			package verb17 _verb
				constant (text) ^name = "to couldn't"
				constant (text) ^infinitive = "couldn't"
				constant (int32) ^meaningless = 0
				constant (text) ^meaning = "&nbsp;<a href='inform://Extensions/Extensions/Graham%20Nelson/English%20Language.html' title=\"English Language by Graham Nelson\" style=\"text-decoration: none\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/Revealext.png></a>"
				constant (text) ^present = "A couldn't B"
				constant (text) ^present_perfect = "A couldn't  have B"
				constant (int32) ^at = 25283
				package conjugation_fn _function
					package call _code __translation="ConjugateVerb33"

								val fn

									inv !case

			package verb18 _verb
				constant (text) ^name = "to shouldn't"
				constant (text) ^infinitive = "shouldn't"
				constant (int32) ^meaningless = 0
				constant (text) ^meaning = "&nbsp;<a href='inform://Extensions/Extensions/Graham%20Nelson/English%20Language.html' title=\"English Language by Graham Nelson\" style=\"text-decoration: none\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/Revealext.png></a>"
				constant (text) ^present = "A shouldn't B"
				constant (text) ^present_perfect = "A shouldn't  have B"
				constant (int32) ^at = 25289
				package conjugation_fn _function
					package call _code __translation="ConjugateVerb34"
						local fn
						local vp
						local t
						local modal_to
						code
							inv !switch
								val fn
								code
									inv !case
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 1
										code
											inv !print
												val "shouldn't"
									inv !case
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 2
										code
											inv !print
												val "shouldn'ted"
									inv !case
										val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 3
										code
											inv !print
												val "shouldn'ting"
									inv !case
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MODAL
										code
											inv !return
												val 1
									inv !case
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_MEANING
										code
											inv !return
												val /main/generic/relations/relation1/Rel_Record1
									inv !case
										val /main/generic/conjugations/CV_POS
										code
											inv !switch
												val t
												code
													inv !case
														val (/main/generic/kinds/kind2/K_number) 1

				constant (text) ^name = "to won't"

					package phrasebook_entry1 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra0', 'plus0'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus0\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;say \"<span style='color:#4040ff'>sayable value</span>\"</p>\n<div id=\"extra0\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('say [=0x0022=][=0x0022=]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;say \"<span style='color:#4040ff'>sayable value</span>\"</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This text substitution takes the value and produces a textual representation of it. Most kinds of value, and really all of the useful ones, are &quot;sayable&quot; - numbers, times, objects, rules, scenes, and so on. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c850\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c850\"></a>The description of the wrist watch is &quot;The dial reads [time of day].&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>Here &quot;time of day&quot; is a value - it's a time that varies, and time is a sayable kind of value, so we might get &quot;The dial reads 11:03 AM.&quot;</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc71.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;5.3. 5.3. Text which names things</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
					package phrasebook_entry2 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra1', 'plus1'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus1\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[<span style='color:#4040ff'>number</span> in words]\"</p>\n<div id=\"extra1\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[... in words]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[<span style='color:#4040ff'>number</span> in words]\"</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This text substitution writes out the number in English text. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c858\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c858\"></a>&quot;You've been wandering around for [turn count in words] turns now.&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>might produce &quot;You've been wandering around for two hundred and thirteen turns now.&quot; The &quot;and&quot; here is natural on one side of the Atlantic but not the other - so with the &quot;Use American dialect.&quot; option in place, it disappears.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc72.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;5.4. 5.4. Text with numbers</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
					package phrasebook_entry3 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra2', 'plus2'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus2\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[s]\"</p>\n<div id=\"extra2\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[s]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[s]\"</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This text substitution prints a letter &quot;s&quot; unless the last number printed was 1. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c860\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c860\"></a>&quot;You've been wandering around for [turn count in words] turn[s] now.&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>produces &quot;... for one turn now.&quot; or &quot;... for two turns now.&quot; as appropriate. Note that it reacts only to numbers, not to other arithmetic values like times (or, for instance, weights from the &quot;Metric Units&quot; extension).</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc72.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;5.4. 5.4. Text with numbers</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
					package phrasebook_entry4 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra3', 'plus3'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus3\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;showme (<span style='color:#4040ff'>value</span>)</p>\n<div id=\"extra3\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('showme')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;showme (<span style='color:#4040ff'>value</span>)</p>\n\n\n                    <p>This phrase is intended for testing purposes only. If used in a story file running inside the Inform application, it prints a line of text showing the given value and its kind; in a Released story file, it does noth ng at all. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c2861\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c2861\"></a>When play begins: showme 11.\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>produces</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c2862\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c2862\"></a>number: 11\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>More usefully:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c2863\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c2863\"></a>Every turn: showme the score.\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>Now, every turn, we get a line in the story's transcript like so:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c2864\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c2864\"></a>&quot;score&quot; = number: 0\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>Inform uses the quotation marks and equals sign to show that it had to do some work to find the answer. &quot;score&quot; wasn't a constant value - it was a variable, and Inform had to look up the current value.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc162.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;11.4. 11.4. The showme phrase</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase value -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
				package phrasebook_heading2 _phrasebook_heading
					constant (text) ^text = "Saying Names"

					package phrasebook_entry4 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/noextra.png>&nbsp;say \"[An <span style='color:#4040ff'>object</span>]\"</p>\n<div id=\"extra7\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[a ...]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[a <span style='color:#4040ff'>object</span>]\"</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This text substitution produces the name of the object along with its indefinite article. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c852\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c852\"></a>Instead of examining something (called the whatever):\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&quot;You can only just make out [a whatever].&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>which might produce &quot;You can only just make out a lamp-post.&quot;, or &quot;You can only just make out Trevor.&quot;, or &quot;You can only just make out some soldiers.&quot; The &quot;a&quot; or &quot;an&quot; in the wording is replaced by whatever indefinite article applies, if any.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc71.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;5.3. 5.3. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c841\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c841\"></a>&quot;He [bracket]Lord Astor[close bracket] would, wouldn't he?&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>prints as &quot;He [Lord Astor] would, wouldn't he?&quot;.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc70.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;5.2. 5.2. 						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra12', 'plus12'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus12\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[apostrophe<span style='color:#808080'>/'</span>]\"</p>\n<div id=\"extra12\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[apostrophe]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[apostrophe<span style='color:#808080'>/'</span>]\"</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This text substitution expands to a single quotation mark, avoiding Inform's ordinary rule of converting literal single quotation marks to double at the edges of words. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c845\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c845\"></a>Instead of going outside, say &quot;Lucy snaps, 'What's the matter? You don't trust my cookin[apostrophe] mister?'&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>produces:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c846\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c846\"></a>Lucy snaps, &quot;What's the matter? You don't trust my cookin' mister?&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>A more abbreviated form would be:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c847\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c847\"></a>Instead of going outside, say &quot;Lucy snaps, 'What's the matter? You don't trust my cookin['] mister?'&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>which has exactly the same meaning.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc70.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;5.2. 5.2. How Inform reads quoted text</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
					package phrasebook_entry4 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra13', 'plus13'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus13\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[quotation mark]\"</p>\n<div id=\"extra13\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[quotation mark]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[quotation mark]\"</p>\n\n\n                    <p>This text substitution expands to a double quotation mark. Most of the time this is unnecessary because of Inform's rule of converting literal single quotation marks to double at the edges of words, so it's needed only if we w nt a double-quote in the middle of a word for some reason. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c848\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c848\"></a>&quot;The compass reads 41o21'23[quotation mark]E.&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>which produces: The compass reads 41o21'23&quot;E. (Note that [&quot;] is not allowed; a double-quotation mark is never allowed inside double-quoted text, not even in a text substitution.)</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc70.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;5.2. 5.2. How Inform reads quoted text</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
				package phrasebook_heading4 _phrasebook_heading
					constant (text) ^text = "Saying Line and Paragraph Breaks"
					package phrasebook_entry1 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra14', 'plus14'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus14\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[line break]\"</p>\n<div id=\"extra14\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[line break]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[line break]\"</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This text substitution produces a line break. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c945\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c945\"></a>&quot;There is an endless sense of[line break]falling and[line break]falling.&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>Line breaks are not paragraph breaks, so the result is:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c946\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c946\"></a>There is an endless sense of\n                    <br>\n                    falling and\n                    <br>\n                    falling.\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>with no extra vertical spacing between these lines.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc76.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;5.8. 5.8. Line breaks and paragraph breaks</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
					package phrasebook_entry2 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra15', 'plus15'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus15\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[no line break]\"</p>\n<div id=\"extra15\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[no line break]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[no line break]\"</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This text substitution produces no text. It's used only for a side-effect: it prevents a line break where Inform might otherwise assume one. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c947\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c947\"></a>&quot;The chorus sing [one of]Jerusalem[or]Rule, Britannia![no line break][at random].&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>Here the &quot;[no line break]&quot; stops Inform from thinking that the exclamation mark means a sentence ending - it's part of the name of the song &quot;Rule, Britannia!&quot;. So we get</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c948\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c948\"></a>The chorus sing Rule, Britannia!.\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>with no line break between the &quot;!&quot; and &quot;.&quot;.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc76.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;5.8. 5.8. Line breaks and paragraph breaks</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
					package phrasebook_entry3 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra16', 'plus16'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus16\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[conditional paragraph break]\"</p>\n<div id=\"extra16\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[conditional paragraph break]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[conditional paragraph break]\"</p>\n\n\n                    <p>This text substitution either produces a paragraph break, or no text at all. It marks a place where Inform can put a paragraph break if necessary; in effect it simulates what Inform does every time a &quot;before&quot; or similar rule finishes. If there i  text already printed, and text then follows on, a paragraph break is made. But if not, nothing is done. This is sometimes useful when producing a large amount of text which changes with the circumstances so that it is hard to predict in advance whether a paragraph break is needed or not.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc76.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;5.8. 5.8. Line breaks and paragraph breaks</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
					package phrasebook_entry4 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra17', 'plus17'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus17\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[paragraph break]\"</p>\n<div id=\"extra17\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[paragraph break]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[paragraph break]\"</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This text substitution produces a paragraph break. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c953\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c953\"></a>&quot;This is not right.[paragraph break]No, something is terribly wrong.&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>Paragraph breaks have a little vertical spacing in them, unlike mere line breaks, so the result is:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c954\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c954\"></a>This is not right.\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <!--START CODE \"c955\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c955\"></a>No, something is terribly wrong.\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc76.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;5.8. 5.8. Line breaks and paragraph breaks</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
					package phrasebook_entry5 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra18', 'plus18'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus18\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[run paragraph on]\"</p>\n<div id=\"extra18\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[run paragraph on]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[run paragraph on]\"</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This text substitution produces no text. It's used only for a side-effect: it prevents a paragraph break occurring after the present text is printed, in case Inform might be tempted to place one there. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c949\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c949\"></a>Before taking something, say &quot;Very well. [run paragraph on]&quot;.\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>This allows the reply to, say, TAKE ENVELOPE to be</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c950\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c950\"></a>Very well. Taken.\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>rather than</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c951\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c951\"></a>Very well.\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <!--START CODE \"c952\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c952\"></a>Taken.\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>which is how texts produced by different rules would normally be shown. (It's a traditional printer's term. See Oldfield's Manual of Typography, 1892, under &quot;When two paragraphs are required to be made into one, or, in technical language, 'to run on'.&quot;)</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc76.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;5.8. 5.8. Line breaks and paragraph breaks</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
					package phrasebook_entry6 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra19', 'plus19'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus19\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;<i>if</i> a paragraph break is pending<i>:</i></p>\n<div id=\"extra19\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('a paragraph break is pending')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;<i>if</i> a paragraph break is pending<i>:</i></p>\n\n\n                    <p>This condition is true if text has recently been said in such a way that Inform expects to add a paragraph break at the next opportunity (for instance when the present rule ends and another one says something, or when a &quot;[conditio al paragraph break]&quot; is made).</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc76.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;5.8. 5.8.
