				package phrasebook_heading5 _phrasebook_heading
					constant (text) ^text = "Saying If and Otherwise"
					package phrasebook_entry1 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra20', 'plus20'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus20\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[if <span style='color:#E00060'>a condition</span>]\"</p>\n<div id=\"extra20\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[if ...]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[if <span style='color:#E00060'>a condition</span>]\"</p>\n\n\n                    <p>This text substitution produces no text. It's used only for a side-effect: it says that the text following should be said only if the condition is true. That continues until the end of the text, or until an &quot;[end if]&quot; substitution  whichever comes first. If the &quot;[otherwise]&quot; and &quot;[otherwise if]&quot; substitutions are also present, they allow alternatives to be added in case the condition is false. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c899\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c899\"></a>The wine cask is a container. The printed name of the cask is &quot;[if open]broached, empty cask[otherwise]sealed wine cask&quot;.\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>we find that the cask is described as &quot;a broached, empty cask&quot; when open, and &quot;a sealed wine cask&quot; when closed. A longer example which begins and ends with fixed text, but has two alternatives in the middle:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c900\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c900\"></a>The Customs Wharf is a room. &quot;Amid the bustle of the quayside, [if the cask is open]many eyes stray to your broached cask. [otherwise]nobody takes much notice of a man heaving a cask about. [end if]Sleek gondolas jostle at the plank pier.&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc74.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;5.6. 5.6. Text with variations</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
					package phrasebook_entry2 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra21', 'plus21'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus21\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[unless <span style='color:#E00060'>a condition</span>]\"</p>\n<div id=\"extra21\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[unless ...]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[unless <span style='color:#E00060'>a condition</span>]\"</p>\n\n\n                    <p>This text substitution produces no text. It's used only for a side-effect: it says that the text following should be said only if the condition is false. That continues until the end of the text, or until an &quot;[end if]&quot; substitution, which ver comes first. If the &quot;[otherwise]&quot; and &quot;[otherwise if]&quot; substitutions are also present, they allow alternatives to be added in case the condition is true. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c901\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c901\"></a>The Customs Hall is a room. &quot;With infinite slowness, with ledgers and quill pens, the clerks ruin their eyesight.[unless the player is a woman] They barely even glance in your direction.&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc74.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;5.6. 5.6. 					package phrasebook_entry3 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra22', 'plus22'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus22\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[otherwise<span style='color:#808080'>/else</span> if <span style='color:#E00060'>a condition</span>]\"</p>\n<div id=\"extra22\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[otherwise if ...]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[otherwise<span style='color:#808080'>/else</span> if <span style='color:#E00060'>a condition</span>]\"</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This text substitution produces no text, and can be used only following an &quot;[if ...]&quot; or &quot;[unless ...]&quot; text substitution. It gives an alternative text to use if the first condition didn't apply, but this one does. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c903\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c903\"></a>The wine cask is a container. The printed name of the cask is &quot;[if open]broached, empty cask[otherwise if transparent]sealed cask half-full of sloshing wine[otherwise]sealed wine cask&quot;.\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc74.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;5.6. 5.6. 						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra25', 'plus25'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus25\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[otherwise]\"</p>\n"
					package phrasebook_entry6 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/noextra.png>&nbsp;say \"[else]\"</p>\n<div id=\"extra25\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[otherwise]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[otherwise]\"</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This text substitution produces no text, and can be used only following an &quot;[if ...]&quot; or &quot;[unless ...]&quot; text substitution. It switches from text which appears if the condition is true, to text which appears if it is false. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c902\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c902\"></a>The wine cask is a container. The printed name of the cask is &quot;[if open]broached, empty cask[otherwise]sealed wine cask&quot;.\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc74.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;5.6. 5.6. 					package phrasebook_entry1 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra28', 'plus28'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus28\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[one of]\"</p>\n<div id=\"extra28\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[one of]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[one of]\"</p>\n\n\n                    <p>This text substitution produces no text. It's used only for a side-effect: it switches between a number of alternative texts, which follow it and are divided by &quot;[or]&quot; substitutions, according to a strategy given in   closing substitution. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c917\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c917\"></a>&quot;You flip the coin. [one of]Heads[or]Tails[purely at random]!&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>Here there are just two alternatives, and the strategy is &quot;purely at random&quot;. Exactly half of the time the text will be printed as &quot;You flip the coin. Heads!&quot;; and the other half, &quot;You flip the coin. Tails!&quot;.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc75.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;5.7. 5.7. Text with random alternatives</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"

It divides alternative wordings. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c918\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c918\"></a>&quot;You flip the coin. [one of]Heads[or]Tails[purely at random]!&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc75.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;5.7. 5.7. Text with random alternatives</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
					package phrasebook_entry3 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra30', 'plus30'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus30\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[at random]\"</p>\n<div id=\"extra30\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[at random]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[at random]\"</p>\n\n\n                    <p>This text substitution produces no text, and can be used only to end a &quot;[one of]...&quot; construction. It indicates that the alternatives are chosen at random except that the same choice cannot come up twice running. This is useful to avoid the deadening effect of repeating the exact same message. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c919\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c919\"></a>&quot;The light changes randomly again; now it's [one of]green[or]amber[or]red[at random].&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>Here we can safely say the light &quot;changes&quot;, because the new colour cannot be the same as the one printed the last time.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc75.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;5.7. 5.7. Text with random alternatives</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"

						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra31', 'plus31'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus31\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[purely at random]\"</p>\n<div id=\"extra31\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[purely at random]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[purely at random]\"</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This text substitution produces no text, and can be used only to end a &quot;[one of]...&quot; construction. It indicates that the alternatives are chosen uniformly randomly.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc75.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;5.7. 5.7. 					package phrasebook_entry5 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra32', 'plus32'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus32\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[then at random]\"</p>\n<div id=\"extra32\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[then at random]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[then at random]\"</p>\n\n\n                    <p>This text substitution produces no text, and can be used only to end a &quot;[one of]...&quot; construction. It indicates that the alternatives are chosen in sequence until all have been seen, and then after that, at random except that the same choice cannot come up twice running. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c920\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c920\"></a>&quot;Maybe the murderer is [one of]Colonel Mustard[or]Professor Plum[or]Cardinal Cerise[then at random].&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc75.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;5.7. 5.7. 						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra33', 'plus33'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus33\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[then purely at random]\"</p>\n<div id=\"extra33\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[then purely at random]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[then purely at random]\"</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This text substitution produces no text, and can be used only to end a &quot;[one of]...&quot; construction. It indicates that the alternatives are chosen in sequence until all have been seen, but that after that they are chosen uniformly randomly.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc75.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;5.7. 5.7. Text with random alternatives</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
					package phrasebook_entry7 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra34', 'plus34'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus34\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[sticky random]\"</p>\n<div id=\"extra34\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[sticky random]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[sticky random]\"</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This text substitution produces no text, and can be used only to end a &quot;[one of]...&quot; construction. It indicates that a random choice is made the first time the text is printed, but that it sticks from there on. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c921\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c921\"></a>&quot;The newspaper headline is: [one of]War Casualties[or]Terrorists[or]Banks[sticky random] [one of]Continue To Expand[or]Lose Out[sticky random].&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>Although the newspaper headline will change with each playing, it will not alter during play.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc75.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;5.7. 5.7. Text with random alternatives</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
					package phrasebook_entry8 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra35', 'plus35'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus35\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[as decreasingly likely outcomes]\"</p>\n<div id=\"extra35\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[as decreasingly likely outcomes]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[as decreasingly likely outcomes]\"</p>\n\n\n                    <p>This text substitution produces no text, and can be used only to end a &quot;[one of]...&quot; construction. It indicates that the alternatives are chosen at random, except that the first is most likely to be chosen, the second is next most likely, and so  n down to the rarest at the end. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c922\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c922\"></a>&quot;Zorro strides by, [one of]looking purposeful[or]grim-faced[or]deep in thought[or]suppressing a yawn[or]scratching his ribs[or]trying to conceal that he has cut himself shaving[as decreasingly likely outcomes].&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>There are six outcomes here: the first is six times as likely as the last, and those in between are similarly scaled, so Zorro cuts himself shaving only once in 21 tries, while he looks purposeful almost a third of the time.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc75.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;5.7. 5.7. Text with random alternatives</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
					package phrasebook_entry9 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra36', 'plus36'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus36\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[in random order]\"</p>\n<div id=\"extra36\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[in random order]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[in random order]\"</p>\n\n\n                    <p>This text substitution produces no text, and can be used only to end a &quot;[one of]...&quot; construction. A random order is chosen for the alternative passages of text, and they are used in that order as the text is printed again an  again. When one random cycle finishes, a new one begins. The effect is somewhat like the &quot;shuffle album&quot; feature on an iPod. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c923\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c923\"></a>&quot;You dip into the chapter on [one of]freshwater fish[or]hairless mammals[or]extinct birds[or]amphibians such as the black salamander[in random order].&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>One small restriction: if there are more than 32 variations, purely random choices will be printed, and there will be no guarantee that repeats are prevented.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc75.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;5.7. 5.7. Text with random alternatives</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
					package phrasebook_entry10 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra37', 'plus37'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus37\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[cycling]\"</p>\n<div id=\"extra37\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[cycling]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[cycling]\"</p>\n\n\n                    <p>This text substitution produces no text, and can be used only to end a &quot;[one of]...&quot; construction. 					package phrasebook_entry13 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/noextra.png>&nbsp;say \"[only]\"</p>\n<div id=\"extra40\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[first time]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[first time]\"</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This pair of text substitutions causes whatever is between them to be printed only the first time the text is printed. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c926\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c926\"></a>&quot;The screen door squeaks loudly as when you open it. [first time]Well, you'll get used to it eventually. [only]&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>This is exactly equivalent to</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c927\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c927\"></a>&quot;The screen door squeaks loudly as when you open it. [one of]Well, you'll get used to it eventually. [or][stopping]&quot;;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>but easier to read.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc75.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;5.7. 5.7. 						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra44', 'plus44'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus44\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[fixed letter spacing]\"</p>\n<div id=\"extra44\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[fixed letter spacing]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[fixed letter spacing]\"</p>\n\n\n                    <p>This text substitution produces no text. It's used only for a side-effect: to make the text following it appear with fixed letter spacing. In variable letter spacing, a lower case &quot;m&quot; is much wider than an &quot;l&quot;, which is natural to the ey  since it has been printing practice since the Renaissance. Fixed letter spacing is more like typewriting, and it is best used to reproduce typewritten text or printed notices; it can also be convenient for making simple diagrams. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c969\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c969\"></a>&quot;On the door is written: [fixed letter spacing]J45--O-O-O[variable letter spacing].&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc77.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;5.9. 5.9. 				package phrasebook_heading8 _phrasebook_heading
					constant (text) ^text = "Saying Lists of Values"
					package phrasebook_entry1 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra46', 'plus46'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus46\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[<span style='color:#4040ff'>list of values</span> in brace notation]\"</p>\n<div id=\"extra46\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[... in brace notation]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[<span style='color:#4040ff'>list of values</span> in brace notation]\"</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This text substitution produces the list in the form of &quot;{&quot;, then a comma-separated list, and then &quot;}&quot;, which looks less like an English sentence but more mathematical. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8332\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8332\"></a>&quot;[list of people in brace notation]&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>might produce &quot;{ yourself, Mr Darcy, Flashman }&quot;.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc354.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;21.3. 21.3. 					package phrasebook_entry2 _phrasebook_entry

					package phrasebook_entry1 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra49', 'plus49'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus49\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;now (<span style='color:#E00060'>a condition</span>)</p>\n<div id=\"extra49\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('now')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;now (<span style='color:#E00060'>a condition</span>)</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase makes the condition become true. Examples:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c1917\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c1917\"></a>now the score is 100;\n                    <br>\n                    now the player is Kevin;\n                    <br>\n                    now the front door is open;\n                    <br>\n                    now Mr Darcy is wearing the top hat;\n                    <br>\n                    now all the doors are open;\n                    <br>\n                    now all of the things in the sack are in the box;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>Inform issues a problem message if the condition asks to do the impossible (&quot;now 3 is an even number&quot;) or is vague (&quot;now the duck is not in the Lily Pond&quot;) or not in the present tense (&quot;now the front door had been open&quot;).</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc126.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;8.11. 8.11. Now...</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase nothing -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
					package phrasebook_entry2 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra50', 'plus50'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus50\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;whether or not (<span style='color:#E00060'>a condition</span>) ... <i>truth state</i></p>\n<div id=\"extra50\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('whether or not')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;whether or not (<span style='color:#E00060'>a condition</span>) ... <i>truth state</i></p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase converts a condition into its result as a value, which is always either &quot;true&quot; or &quot;false&quot;. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c2873\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c2873\"></a>whether or not 20 is an odd number\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>produces the truth state &quot;false&quot;. This is mostly useful for storing up results to look at later:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c2874\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c2874\"></a>let victory be whether or not all the treasures are in the cabinet;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>and then subsequently:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c2875\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c2875\"></a>if victory is true, ...\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc163.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;11.5. 11.5. Conditions and questions</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase nothing -> truth state</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
				package phrasebook_heading10 _phrasebook_heading
					constant (text) ^text = "Assigning Temporary Variables"
					package phrasebook_entry1 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra51', 'plus51'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus51\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;let (<span style='color:#E00060'>a new name</span>) be (<span style='color:#4040ff'>value</span>)</p>\n<div id=\"extra51\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('let ... be')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;let (<span style='color:#E00060'>a new name</span>) be (<span style='color:#4040ff'>value</span>)</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase creates a new temporary variable, starting it with the value supplied. The variable lasts only for the present block of phrases, which certainly means that it lasts only for the current rule. Examples:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c3004\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c3004\"></a>let outer bull be 25;\n                    <br>\n                    let the current appearance be &quot;reddish brown&quot;;\n                    <br>\n                    let the special room be Marley Wood;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>The kinds of these are deduced from the values given, so that, for instance,</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c3005\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c3005\"></a>say &quot;The outer bull scores [the outer bull in words] when you practice archery in [special room].&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>produces</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c3006\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c3006\"></a>The outer bull scores twenty-five when you practice archery in Marley Wood.\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>The variable name should be a new one; if it's the name of an existing one, then the kinds must agree. So:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c3007\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c3007\"></a>let outer bull be 25;\n                    <br>\n                    let outer bull be 50;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>is a legal combination, because the second &quot;let&quot; simply changes the value of the existing &quot;outer bull&quot; variable to a different number.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc173.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;11.15. 11.15. Let and temporary variables</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase (value, value) -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
					package phrasebook_entry2 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra52', 'plus52'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus52\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;let (<span style='color:#E00060'>a new name</span>) be (<span style='color:#E00060'>name of kind</span>)</p>\n<div id=\"extra52\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('let ... be')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;let (<span style='color:#E00060'>a new name</span>) be (<span style='color:#E00060'>name of kind</span>)</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase creates a new temporary variable of the given kind. The variable lasts only for the present block of phrases, which certainly means that it lasts only for the current rule. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c3008\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c3008\"></a>let inner bull be a number;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>The variable created holding the default value for that kind - in this case, the number 0. A handful of very obscure kinds have no default values, and then a problem message is produced. Inform also disallows:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c3009\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c3009\"></a>let the conveyance be a vehicle;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>because temporary variables aren't allowed to have kinds more specific than &quot;object&quot;. (This is a good thing: suppose there are no vehicles in the world?) It's quite safe in such cases to use</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c3010\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c3010\"></a>let the conveyance be an object;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>instead, which creates it as the special object value &quot;nothing&quot;.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc173.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;11.15. 11.15. Let and temporary variables</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase (value, value) -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
					package phrasebook_entry3 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra53', 'plus53'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus53\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;let (<span style='color:#E00060'>a new name</span>) be (<span style='color:#4040ff'>description of relations of values</span>)</p>\n<div id=\"extra53\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('let ... be')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;let (<span style='color:#E00060'>a new name</span>) be (<span style='color:#4040ff'>description of relations of values</span>)</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase creates a new temporary variable, and sets its value to the identity of a newly created and equally temporary relation. These last only for the present block of phrases, which certainly means that they exist only in the current rule. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c4247\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c4247\"></a>let the password dictionary be a relation of texts;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>This makes a purely temporary various-to-various relation between texts, which lasts as long as the temporary value &quot;password dictionary&quot; lasts. By default, relations are various-to-various, but we could instead write, say:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c4248\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c4248\"></a>let the nicknames catalogue be a various-to-one relation of texts;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc212.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;13.15. 13.15. Temporary relations</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase (value, description of relations of Ks to Ls) -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
					package phrasebook_entry4 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra54', 'plus54'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus54\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;let (<span style='color:#E00060'>a new name</span>) be given by (<span style='color:#4040ff'>equation name</span>)</p>\n<div id=\"extra54\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('let ... be given by')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;let (<span style='color:#E00060'>a new name</span>) be given by (<span style='color:#4040ff'>equation name</span>)</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase creates a new temporary variable, starting it with the value found by solving the given equation. The variable lasts only for the present block of phrases, which certainly means that it lasts only for the current rule. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c4830\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c4830\"></a>let F be given by Newton's Second Law where a is the acceleration due to gravity;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>There is also a more compact syntax, giving the equation explicitly:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c4831\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c4831\"></a>let KE be given by KE = mv^2/2 where KE is an energy;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc243.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;15.18. 15.18. Equations</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase (value, equation name) -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
					package phrasebook_entry5 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra55', 'plus55'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus55\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;let (<span style='color:#E00060'>a temporary named value</span>) be (<span style='color:#4040ff'>value</span>)</p>\n<div id=\"extra55\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('let ... be')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;let (<span style='color:#E00060'>a temporary named value</span>) be (<span style='color:#4040ff'>value</span>)</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase creates a new temporary variable, starting it with the value supplied. The variable lasts only for the present block of phrases, which certainly means that it lasts only for the current rule. Examples:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c3004\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c3004\"></a>let outer bull be 25;\n                    <br>\n                    let the current appearance be &quot;reddish brown&quot;;\n                    <br>\n                    let the special room be Marley Wood;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>The kinds of these are deduced from the values given, so that, for instance,</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c3005\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c3005\"></a>say &quot;The outer bull scores [the outer bull in words] when you practice archery in [special room].&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>produces</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c3006\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c3006\"></a>The outer bull scores twenty-five when you practice archery in Marley Wood.\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>The variable name should be a new one; if it's the name of an existing one, then the kinds must agree. So:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c3007\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c3007\"></a>let outer bull be 25;\n                    <br>\n                    let outer bull be 50;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>is a legal combination, because the second &quot;let&quot; simply changes the value of the existing &quot;outer bull&quot; variable to a different number.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc173.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;11.15. 11.15. Let and temporary variables</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase (value, value) -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"

Examples:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c4547\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c4547\"></a>201 divided by 3 = 67\n                    <br>\n                    202 divided by 3 = 67\n                    <br>\n                    202.0 divided by 3 = 67.33334\n                    <br>\n                    twenty minutes divided by 4 = five minutes\n                    <br>\n                    twenty minutes divided by five minutes = 4\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>Division rounds whole-number values down to the nearest whole number. An attempt to divide a number by 0 will cause a run-time problem message; but an attempt to divide a real number by 0 will instead produce plus infinity or minus infinity.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc230.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;15.5. 15.5. Examples:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c4548\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c4548\"></a>remainder after dividing 201 by 5 = 1\n                    <br>\n                    remainder after dividing twenty minutes by 7 = six minutes\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>It is mathematically impossible to divide by 0, so any attempt to find the remainder after dividing a number by 0 will cause a run-time problem message. For a real number this won't arise and the remainder will usually be 0.0.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc230.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;15.5. 15.5. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c4551\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c4551\"></a>square root of 16 = 4\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>Trying to take the square root of a negative number will cause a run-time problem, because then we can't even nearly solve it.</p>\n                    <p>(Warning: this is slow to compute if the Z-machine setting is used. 						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra74', 'plus74'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus74\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;total (<span style='color:#4040ff'>arithmetic values valued property</span>) of (<span style='color:#4040ff'>description of values</span>) ... <i>value</i></p>\n<div id=\"extra74\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('total ... of')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;total (<span style='color:#4040ff'>arithmetic values valued property</span>) of (<span style='color:#4040ff'>description of values</span>) ... <i>value</i></p>\n\n\n                    <p>This phrase produces the total of some property held by all of the values matching the description. A problem message is produced if the values in question can't have that property (&quot;the total carrying capacity of scenes&quot;), or if it holds a kind of value which can't meaningfully be ad ed up (&quot;the total description of open doors&quot;). Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c4754\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c4754\"></a>total carrying capacity of people in the Deep Pool\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc242.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;15.17. 15.17. 				package phrasebook_heading13 _phrasebook_heading
					constant (text) ^text = "Saying Real Numbers"
					package phrasebook_entry1 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra75', 'plus75'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus75\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[<span style='color:#4040ff'>real number</span> to <span style='color:#4040ff'>number</span> decimal places]\"</p>\n<div id=\"extra75\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[... to ... decimal places]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[<span style='color:#4040ff'>real number</span> to <span style='color:#4040ff'>number</span> decimal places]\"</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This text substitution writes out the number to the given number of decimal places. Examples:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c4541\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c4541\"></a>&quot;The semicircle is roughly [pi to 3 decimal places] paces around.&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>produces &quot;The semicircle is roughly 3.142 paces around.&quot; The number of places can only usefully be from 1 to 8. Note that, for example, &quot;[1.235 x 10^-7 to 3 decimal places]&quot; produces 0.0; &quot;[1.235678 x 10^8 to 3 decimal places]&quot; produces &quot;1.236 x 10^8&quot;.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc229.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;15.4. 15.4. Printing real numbers</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
					package phrasebook_entry2 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra76', 'plus76'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus76\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[<span style='color:#4040ff'>real number</span> in decimal notation]\"</p>\n<div id=\"extra76\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[... in decimal notation]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[<span style='color:#4040ff'>real number</span> in decimal notation]\"</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This text substitution writes out the number in decimal form, that is, avoiding &quot;x 10^n&quot; even for very large or very small quantities. For example,</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c4542\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c4542\"></a>&quot;[1.23457 x 10^8 in decimal notation]&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>produces 123457000.0 rather than 1.23457 x 10^8. This can look pretty extreme: for example, &quot;[1.8983 x 10^27 in decimal notation]&quot;, the mass of the planet Jupiter in kilograms, produces 1898296960000000000000000000.0.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc229.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;15.4. 15.4. This is better from a mathematical point of view, but in practice most people think about angles using degree , where 180 degrees is a half-circle and a right angle is 90 degrees. This phrase helps with that by converting from degrees to radians: in other words, it multiplies by 0.0174532925, since that's roughly 1/180th of pi. Examples:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c4565\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c4565\"></a>sine of 90 degrees = 0.0\n                    <br>\n                    cosine of 60 degrees = 0.5\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc232.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;15.7. 15.7. Trigonometry</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase real number -> real number</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"

It is most often used in the definition of other phrases:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c2984\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c2984\"></a>To judge the score:\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;if the score is 0, stop;\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;say &quot;The score is [score in words] more than it was a half-hour ago.&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>In the case when the score is 0, the &quot;stop&quot; ends the phrase immediately, so that the subsequent text is printed only if the score is not 0.</p>\n                    <p>&quot;Stop&quot; can also be used in action rules, though this is not very good style - it's clearer to use &quot;stop the action&quot;, which is exactly equivalent.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc171.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;11.13. 11.13. 						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra110', 'plus110'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus110\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;if (<span style='color:#4040ff'>value</span>) is:\n</p>\n<div id=\"extra110\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('if ... is:[=0x000A=]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;if (<span style='color:#4040ff'>value</span>) is:\n                </p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase switches between a variety of possible blocks of phrases to follow, depending on the value given. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c2929\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c2929\"></a>if the dangerous item is:\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;-- the electric hairbrush:\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;say &quot;Mind your head.&quot;;\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;-- the silver spoon:\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;say &quot;Steer clear of the cutlery drawer.&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>One alternative is allowed to be &quot;otherwise&quot;, which is used only if none of the other cases apply, and which therefore guarantees that in any situation exactly one of the blocks will be followed.</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c2930\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c2930\"></a>if N is:\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;-- 1: say &quot;1.&quot;;\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;-- 2: say &quot;2.&quot;;\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;-- otherwise: say &quot;Neither 1 nor 2.&quot;;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc166.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;11.8. 11.8. Otherwise</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase value -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"

						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra112', 'plus112'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus112\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;while (<span style='color:#E00060'>a condition</span>):\n</p>\n<div id=\"extra112\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('while ...:[=0x000A=]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;while (<span style='color:#E00060'>a condition</span>):\n                </p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase causes the block of phrases following it to be repeated over and over for as long the condition is true. If it isn't even true the first time, the block is skipped over and nothing happens. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c2938\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c2938\"></a>while someone (called the victim) is in the Crypt:\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;say &quot;A bolt of lightning strikes [the victim]!&quot;;\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;now the victim is in the Afterlife;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc167.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;11.9. 11.9. While</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase nothing -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
