					package phrasebook_entry3 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/noextra.png>&nbsp;repeat with (<span style='color:#E00060'>a new name</span>) running from (<span style='color:#4040ff'>enumerated value</span>) to (<span style='color:#4040ff'>enumerated value</span>):\n</p>\n<div id=\"extra114\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('repeat with ... running from ... to ...:[=0x000A=]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;repeat with (<span style='color:#E00060'>a new name</span>) running from (<span style='color:#4040ff'>arithmetic value</span>) to (<span style='color:#4040ff'>arithmetic value</span>):\n                </p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase causes the block of phrases following it to be repeated once for each value in the given range, storing that value in the named variable. (The variable exists only temporarily, within the repetition.) Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c2942\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c2942\"></a>repeat with counter running from 1 to 10:\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;...\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>This, and runs through the given phrases ten times. Within those phrases, a special value called &quot;counter&quot; has the value 1 the first time through, then the value 2, then 3 and so on up to 10. (It can of course be called whatever we like: this is only an example.) The range can be from any kind where ranges make sense - anything on which arithmetic can be done, so for instance</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c2943\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c2943\"></a>repeat with moment running from 4 PM to 4:07 PM:\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;...\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>and also any enumeration:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c2944\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c2944\"></a>Colour is a kind of value. The colours are red, orange, yellow, green, blue, indigo and violet.\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <!--START CODE \"c2945\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c2945\"></a>...\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;repeat with hue running from orange to indigo:\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;...\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc168.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;11.10. 11.10. Repeat</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase (K, K [arithmetic value], K) -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"

						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra115', 'plus115'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus115\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;repeat with (<span style='color:#E00060'>a new name</span>) running through (<span style='color:#4040ff'>description of values</span>):\n</p>\n<div id=\"extra115\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('repeat with ... running through ...:[=0x000A=]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;repeat with (<span style='color:#E00060'>a new name</span>) running through (<span style='color:#4040ff'>description of values</span>):\n                </p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase causes the block of phrases following it to be repeated once for each value matching the description, storing that value in the named variable. (The variable exists only temporarily, within the repetition.) Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c2959\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c2959\"></a>repeat with item running through open containers:\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;...\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>If there are no containers, or they are all closed, the phrases will not be followed at all. Inform will issue a Problem message if the range of the loop may be infinite: for example, it won't allow:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c2960\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c2960\"></a>repeat with X running through odd numbers:\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;...\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>On the other hand it will allow:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c2961\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c2961\"></a>repeat with T running through times:\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;...\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>which repeats 1440 times, starting with T at midnight and finishing at 11:59 PM. See the Kinds index for which kinds of value can be repeated through.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc169.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;11.11. 11.11. Repeat running through</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase (K, description of Ks) -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"

						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra116', 'plus116'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus116\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;repeat with (<span style='color:#E00060'>a new name</span>) running through (<span style='color:#4040ff'>list of values</span>):\n</p>\n<div id=\"extra116\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('repeat with ... running through ...:[=0x000A=]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;repeat with (<span style='color:#E00060'>a new name</span>) running through (<span style='color:#4040ff'>list of values</span>):\n                </p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase causes the block of phrases following it to be repeated once for each item in the given list, storing that value in the named variable. (The variable exists only temporarily, within the repetition.) Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8366\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8366\"></a>let L be {2, 3, 5, 7, 11, 13, 17, 19};\n                    <br>\n                    repeat with prime running through L:\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;...\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>If the list is empty, nothing happens: the &quot;...&quot; phrase(s) are never tried.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc355.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;21.4. 21.4. Testing and iterating over lists</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase (object, list of values) -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"

Repeating through tables</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase table name -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"

						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra119', 'plus119'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus119\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;repeat through (<span style='color:#4040ff'>table name</span>) in (<span style='color:#4040ff'>table column</span>) order:\n</p>\n<div id=\"extra119\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('repeat through ... in ... order:[=0x000A=]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;repeat through (<span style='color:#4040ff'>table name</span>) in (<span style='color:#4040ff'>table column</span>) order:\n                </p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase causes the block of phrases following it to be repeated once for each row in the given table, choosing each row in turn, in order of the values in the given column. Blank rows are skipped. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c5087\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c5087\"></a>repeat through the Table of Recent Monarchs in name order: ...\n                    <br>\n                    repeat through the Table of Recent Monarchs in accession order: ...\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>work through the same table in rather different orders. The sequence is lower to higher (small numbers to high numbers, A to Z, and so on); insert &quot;reverse&quot; after &quot;in&quot; to reverse this.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc251.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;16.6. 16.6. Repeating through tables</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase (table name, table column) -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
					package phrasebook_entry9 _phrasebook_entry

Blank rows are skipped. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c5088\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c5088\"></a>repeat through the Table of Recent Monarchs in reverse name order: ...\n                    <br>\n                    repeat through the Table of Recent Monarchs in reverse accession order: ...\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>work through the same table in rather different orders. The sequence is higher to lower (high numbers to small numbers, Z to A, and so on); delete the &quot;reverse&quot; after &quot;in&quot; to reverse this.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc251.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;16.6. 16.6. 						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra121', 'plus121'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus121\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;break</p>\n<div id=\"extra121\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('break')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;break</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase can only be used inside &quot;repeat&quot;, &quot;while&quot; block, and causes both the current repetition and the entire loop to finish immediately. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c2983\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c2983\"></a>repeat with X running from 1 to 10:\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;if X is 7, break;\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;say &quot;[X] &quot;.\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>produces the text &quot;1 2 3 4 5 6 &quot;, with nothing after &quot;6&quot; because the loop was broken at that point. The &quot;say&quot; wasn't reached on the 7th repetition, and the 8th, 9th and 10th never happened.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc170.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;11.12. 11.12. Next and break</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase nothing -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
					package phrasebook_entry2 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra122', 'plus122'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus122\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;next</p>\n<div id=\"extra122\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('next')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;next</p>\n\n\n                    <p>This phrase can only be used inside a &quot;repeat&quot; or &quot;while&quot; block, and causes the current repetition of the block to finish immediately. That either means the next repetition begins, or (if we are a ready at the last one) the loop ends too. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c2982\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c2982\"></a>repeat with X running from 1 to 10:\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;if X is 4, next;\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;say &quot;[X] &quot;.\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>produces the text &quot;1 2 3 5 6 7 8 9 10 &quot;, with no &quot;4&quot; because the &quot;say&quot; phrase was never reached on the fourth repetition.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc170.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;11.12. 11.12. Next and break</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase nothing -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"

Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c1044\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c1044\"></a>number of open doors\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>produces the number of doors, anywhere in the model world, which are currently open. A Problem message is produced if the number is potentially infinite, or impractical to count: for instance, Inform rejects &quot;number of odd numbers&quot;.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc82.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;6.1. 6.1. 						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra128', 'plus128'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus128\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;a<span style='color:#808080'>/--</span> random (<span style='color:#4040ff'>description of values</span>) ... <i>value</i></p>\n<div id=\"extra128\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('a random')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;a<span style='color:#808080'>/--</span> random (<span style='color:#4040ff'>description of values</span>) ... <i>value</i></p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase makes a uniformly random choice from values satisfying the description given. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c2035\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c2035\"></a>a random visited room\n                    <br>\n                    a random scene\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>A problem message is issued if the range is too large (for instance, &quot;a random text&quot;). Unexpected results may follow if no value fits the description, unless we are describing objects, in which case the result is the special value &quot;nothing&quot;.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc134.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;8.19. 8.19. The cloud patterns are cumulus, altocumulus, cumulonimbus, stratus, cirrus, nimbus, nimbostratus.\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>then we can also take random values from it:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c1990\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c1990\"></a>a random cloud pattern between stratus and nimbus\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>which has three possible outcomes, all equally likely.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc133.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;8.18. 8.18. Any random numbers generated after that depend only on the seed. Example: the following sentence will &quot;fix&quot; the process of generating these random numbers so that they are not random at all - t e same sequence of random numbers will be produced on each run.</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c1993\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c1993\"></a>When play begins, seed the random-number generator with 1234.\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>The seed value &quot;1234&quot; can be anything positive; a different sequence of random numbers will be produced for each different seed value. A seed value of 0 restores the RNG to properly random behaviour again.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc133.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;8.18. 8.18. Randomness</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase number -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"

						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra135', 'plus135'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus135\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;default value of (<span style='color:#E00060'>name of kind</span>) ... <i>value</i></p>\n<div id=\"extra135\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('default value of')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;default value of (<span style='color:#E00060'>name of kind</span>) ... <i>value</i></p>\n\n\n                    <p>    Produces the default value of the kind named. Examples:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c707\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c707\"></a>The silver repeater is here. &quot;You catch sight of a silver repeater watch, hands immobile at [default value of time].&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>produces the output:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c708\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c708\"></a>You catch sight of a silver repeater watch, hands immobile at 9:00 am.\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>because nine in the morning is the default time in Inform. If we have:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c709\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c709\"></a>Brightness is a kind of value. The brightnesses are guttering, weak, radiant and blazing.\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>then &quot;default value of brightness&quot; is guttering, the first brightness created.  When it comes to kinds of object, we sometimes have to be a little careful. For example,</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c710\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c710\"></a>default value of room\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>is always going to be fine (it's always the first room created in the source text). But</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c711\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c711\"></a>default value of vehicle\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>would produce a Problem message if there were no vehicles in the world.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc62.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;4.11. 4.11. Default values of kinds</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase K -> K</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"

						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra144', 'plus144'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus144\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;punctuated word number (<span style='color:#4040ff'>number</span>) in (<span style='color:#4040ff'>text</span>) ... <i>text</i></p>\n<div id=\"extra144\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('punctuated word number ... in')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;punctuated word number (<span style='color:#4040ff'>number</span>) in (<span style='color:#4040ff'>text</span>) ... <i>text</i></p>\n\n\n                    <p>This phrase produces the Nth word from the text, counting from 1. Words for this purpose are what's left after breaking the text up at punctuation or spacing (spaces, line breaks, paragraph breaks) and then removing the spacing, but leaving the punctuation as  ndependent words. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8081\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8081\"></a>punctuated word number 2 in &quot;ice-hot, don't you think?&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>produces &quot;-&quot;. The punctuated words here are &quot;ice&quot;, &quot;-&quot;, &quot;hot&quot;, &quot;,&quot;, &quot;don't&quot;, &quot;you&quot;, &quot;think&quot;, &quot;?&quot;. If two or more punctuation marks are adjacent, they are counted as different words, except for runs of dashes or periods: thus &quot;,,&quot; has two punctuated words, but &quot;--&quot; and &quot;...&quot; have only one each. If the index is less than 1 or more than the number of punctuated words in the text, the result is an empty text, &quot;&quot;.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc345.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;20.3. 20.3. Characters, words, punctuated words, unpunctuated words, lines, paragraphs</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase (number, text) -> text</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"

						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra148', 'plus148'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus148\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;substituted form of (<span style='color:#4040ff'>text</span>) ... <i>text</i></p>\n<div id=\"extra148\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('substituted form of')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;substituted form of (<span style='color:#4040ff'>text</span>) ... <i>text</i></p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This takes a text and makes substitution occur immediately. For example,</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8172\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8172\"></a>substituted form of &quot;time of death, [time of day]&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>produces something like &quot;time of death, 9:15 AM&quot; rather than &quot;time of death, [time of day]&quot;. It's entirely legal to apply this to text which never had any substitutions in, so</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8173\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8173\"></a>substituted form of &quot;balloon&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>produces &quot;balloon&quot;.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc349.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;20.7. 20.7. Making new text with text substitutions</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase text -> text</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"

						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra149', 'plus149'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus149\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;<i>if</i> (<span style='color:#4040ff'>text</span>) exactly matches the text (<span style='color:#4040ff'>text</span>)<i>:</i></p>\n<div id=\"extra149\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('exactly matches the text')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;<i>if</i> (<span style='color:#4040ff'>text</span>) exactly matches the text (<span style='color:#4040ff'>text</span>)<i>:</i>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br>\n                <i>optionally</i> <a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[=0x000A=]case insensitively[=0x000A=][=0x000A=]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;case insensitively\n                </p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This condition is true if the second text matches the first, starting at the beginning and finishing at the end. This appears to be the same as testing if one is equal to the other, but that's not quite true: for example,</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8109\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8109\"></a>if &quot;[score]&quot; exactly matches the text &quot;[best score]&quot;, ...\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>is true if the score and best score currently print out as the same text, which will be true if they are currently equal as numbers; but</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8110\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8110\"></a>if &quot;[score]&quot; is &quot;[best score]&quot;, ...\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>is never true - these are different texts, even if they sometimes look the same.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc347.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;20.5. 20.5. Matching and exactly matching</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase (text, text) -> truth state</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
					package phrasebook_entry2 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra150', 'plus150'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus150\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;<i>if</i> (<span style='color:#4040ff'>text</span>) matches the text (<span style='color:#4040ff'>text</span>)<i>:</i></p>\n<div id=\"extra150\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('matches the text')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;<i>if</i> (<span style='color:#4040ff'>text</span>) matches the text (<span style='color:#4040ff'>text</span>)<i>:</i>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br>\n                <i>optionally</i> <a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[=0x000A=]case insensitively[=0x000A=][=0x000A=]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;case insensitively\n                </p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This condition is true if the second text occurs anywhere inside the first. Examples:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8106\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8106\"></a>if &quot;[score]&quot; matches the text &quot;3&quot;, ...\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>tests whether the digit 3 occurs anywhere in the score, as printed out; and</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8107\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8107\"></a>if the printed name of the location matches the text &quot;the&quot;, ...\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>tests to see whether &quot;the&quot; can be found anywhere in the current room's name. Note that the location &quot;Smotheringly Hot Jungle&quot; would pass this test - it's there if you look. On the other hand, &quot;The Orangery&quot; would not, because &quot;The&quot; does not match against &quot;the&quot;. We can get around this in a variety of ways, one of which is to tell Inform to be insensitive to the case (upper or lower) of letters:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8108\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8108\"></a>if the printed name of the location matches the text &quot;the&quot;, case insensitively: ...\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc347.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;20.5. 20.5. Matching and exactly matching</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase (text, text) -> truth state</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"

The matches are not allowed to overlap. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8111\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8111\"></a>number of times &quot;pell-mell sally&quot; matches the text &quot;ll&quot; = 3\n                    <br>\n                    number of times &quot;xyzzy&quot; matches the text &quot;Z&quot; = 0\n                    <br>\n                    number of times &quot;xyzzy&quot; matches the text &quot;Z&quot;, case insensitively = 2\n                    <br>\n                    number of times &quot;aaaaaaaa&quot; matches the text &quot;aaaa&quot; = 2\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc347.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;20.5. 20.5. Matching and exactly matching</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase (text, text) -> number</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"

Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8249\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8249\"></a>replace the text &quot;a&quot; in V with &quot;z&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>changes every lower-case &quot;a&quot; to &quot;z&quot;: the same thing done with the &quot;case insensitively&quot; option would change each &quot;a&quot; or &quot;A&quot; to &quot;z&quot;.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc350.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;20.8. 20.8. 						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra155', 'plus155'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus155\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;replace character number (<span style='color:#4040ff'>number</span>) in (<span style='color:#4040ff'>text</span>) with (<span style='color:#4040ff'>text</span>)</p>\n<div id=\"extra155\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('replace character number ... in ... with')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;replace character number (<span style='color:#4040ff'>number</span>) in (<span style='color:#4040ff'>text</span>) with (<span style='color:#4040ff'>text</span>)</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase acts on the named text by placing the given text in place of the Nth character, counting from 1. Examples:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8112\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8112\"></a>if &quot;taramasalata&quot; matches the regular expression &quot;a.*l&quot;, ...\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>is true, since this looks for a part of &quot;taramasalata&quot; which begins with &quot;a&quot;, continues with any number of characters, and finishes with &quot;l&quot;; so it matches &quot;aramasal&quot;. (Not &quot;asal&quot;, because it gets the makes the leftmost match it can.) The option &quot;case insensitively&quot; causes lower and upper case letters to be treated as equivalent.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc348.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;20.6. 20.6. 					package phrasebook_entry5 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra165', 'plus165'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus165\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;number of times (<span style='color:#4040ff'>text</span>) matches the regular expression (<span style='color:#4040ff'>text</span>) ... <i>number</i></p>\n<div id=\"extra165\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('number of times ... matches the regular expression')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;number of times (<span style='color:#4040ff'>text</span>) matches the regular expression (<span style='color:#4040ff'>text</span>) ... <i>number</i>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br>\n                <i>optionally</i> <a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('case insensitively[=0x000A=][=0x000A=]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;case insensitively\n                </p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This produces the number of times that contiguous pieces of the text can be matched against the regular expression, without allowing them to overlap.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc348.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;20.6. 20.6. Regular expression matching</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase (text, text) -> number</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
					package phrasebook_entry6 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra166', 'plus166'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus166\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;replace the regular expression (<span style='color:#4040ff'>text</span>) in (<span style='color:#4040ff'>text</span>) with (<span style='color:#4040ff'>text</span>)</p>\n<div id=\"extra166\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('replace the regular expression ... in ... with')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;replace the regular expression (<span style='color:#4040ff'>text</span>) in (<span style='color:#4040ff'>text</span>) with (<span style='color:#4040ff'>text</span>)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br>\n                <i>optionally</i> <a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('case insensitively[=0x000A=][=0x000A=]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;case insensitively\n                </p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase acts on the named text by matching the regular expression and replacing anything which fits it, as many non-overlapping times as possible. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8252\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8252\"></a>replace the regular expression &quot;\\d+&quot; in V with &quot;...&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>changes &quot;The Battle of Waterloo, 1815, rivalled Trafalgar, 1805&quot; to &quot;The Battle of Waterloo, ..., rivalled Trafalgar, ...&quot;. The &quot;case insensitively&quot; causes lower and upper case letters to be treated as if the same letter.</p>\n                    <p>When replacing a regular expression, the replacement text also has a few special meanings (though, thankfully, many fewer than for the expression itself). Once again &quot;\\n&quot; and &quot;\\t&quot; can be used for line break and tab characters, and &quot;\\\\&quot; must be used for an actual backslash. But, very usefully, &quot;\\1&quot; to &quot;\\9&quot; expand as the contents of groups numbered 1 to 9, and &quot;\\0&quot; to the exact text matched. So:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8253\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8253\"></a>replace the regular expression &quot;\\d+&quot; in V with &quot;roughly \\0&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>adds the word &quot;roughly&quot; in front of any run of digits in V, because \\0 becomes in turn whichever run of digits matched. And</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8254\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8254\"></a>replace the regular expression &quot;(\\w+) (.*)&quot; in V with &quot;\\2, \\1&quot;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>performs the transformation &quot;Frank Booth&quot; to &quot;Booth, Frank&quot;.</p>\n                    <p>Finally, prefixing the number by &quot;l&quot; or &quot;u&quot; forces the text it represents into lower or upper case, respectively. For instance:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8255\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8255\"></a>replace the regular expression &quot;\\b(\\w)(\\w*)&quot; in X with &quot;\\u1\\l2&quot;;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>changes the casing of X to &quot;title casing&quot;, where each individual word is capitalised. (This is a little slow on large texts, since so many matches and replacements are made: it's more efficient to use the official phrases for changing case.)</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc350.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;20.8. 20.8. Replacements</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase (text, text, text) -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"

						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra173', 'plus173'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus173\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[infinitive of <span style='color:#4040ff'>verb</span>]\"</p>\n<div id=\"extra173\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('[infinitive of ...]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;say \"[infinitive of <span style='color:#4040ff'>verb</span>]\"</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    Produces the infinitive of the given verb. Note that this is without a &quot;to&quot;: for example, &quot;[infinitive of the verb carry]&quot; is &quot;carry&quot;, not &quot;to carry&quot;.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc222.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;14.9. 14.9. For example, &quot;[past participle of the verb carry]&quot; is &quot;carried&quot;. Warning: because modal verbs like &quot;should&quot; or &quot;might&quot; are defective in English, this will produce odd results on them - &quot;shoulded&quot; and &quot;mighted&quot;, for example.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc222.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;14.9. 14.9. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c5084\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c5084\"></a>choose row with a name of &quot;Victoria&quot; in the Table of Recent Monarchs;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>A run-time problem message is produced if the value isn't found anywhere in that column.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc250.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;16.5. 16.5. A run-time problem message is issued if no rows are blank. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c5132\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c5132\"></a>choose a blank row in Table 3;\n                    <br>\n                    now element entry is &quot;Fluorine&quot;;\n                    <br>\n                    now symbol entry is &quot;F&quot;;\n                    <br>\n                    now atomic number entry is 9;\n                    <br>\n                    now atomic weight entry is 19;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc255.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;16.10. 16.10. Note that although a table always has at least one row, it can't be guaranteed that it always has a non-blank row, so it's possible for this to fail: if it does, a real-time problem message is thrown.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc250.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;16.5. 16.5. 						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra202', 'plus202'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus202\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;sort (<span style='color:#4040ff'>table name</span>) in<span style='color:#808080'>/into</span> random order</p>\n<div id=\"extra202\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('sort ... in random order')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;sort (<span style='color:#4040ff'>table name</span>) in<span style='color:#808080'>/into</span> random order</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase rearranges the rows of the given table so that the non-blank rows occur at the top, in a uniformly random order, and any blank rows at the bottom. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c5150\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c5150\"></a>sort the Table of Recent Monarchs in random order;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc256.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;16.11. 16.11. Sorting</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase table name -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
					package phrasebook_entry2 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra203', 'plus203'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus203\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;sort (<span style='color:#4040ff'>table name</span>) in<span style='color:#808080'>/into</span> (<span style='color:#4040ff'>table column</span>) order</p>\n<div id=\"extra203\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('sort ... in ... order')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;sort (<span style='color:#4040ff'>table name</span>) in<span style='color:#808080'>/into</span> (<span style='color:#4040ff'>table column</span>) order</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase rearranges the rows of the given table so that the non-blank rows occur at the top, so that the given column has ascending order, and any blank rows at the bottom. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c5151\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c5151\"></a>sort the Table of Recent Monarchs in accession order;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>Ascending order means 1 up to 10, say, or A up to Z, with blank values coming last.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc256.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;16.11. 16.11. Sorting</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase (table name, table column) -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
					package phrasebook_entry3 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra204', 'plus204'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus204\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;sort (<span style='color:#4040ff'>table name</span>) in<span style='color:#808080'>/into</span> reverse (<span style='color:#4040ff'>table column</span>) order</p>\n<div id=\"extra204\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('sort ... in reverse ... order')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;sort (<span style='color:#4040ff'>table name</span>) in<span style='color:#808080'>/into</span> reverse (<span style='color:#4040ff'>table column</span>) order</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase rearranges the rows of the given table so that the non-blank rows occur at the top, so that the given column has descending order, and any blank rows at the bottom. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c5152\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c5152\"></a>sort the Table of Recent Monarchs in reverse name order;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>Descending order means 10 down to 1, say, or Z down to A, with blank values coming last.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc256.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;16.11. 16.11. Sorting</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase (table name, table column) -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"

						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra205', 'plus205'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus205\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;add (<span style='color:#4040ff'>value</span>) to (<span style='color:#4040ff'>list of values</span>)</p>\n<div id=\"extra205\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('add ... to')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;add (<span style='color:#4040ff'>value</span>) to (<span style='color:#4040ff'>list of values</span>)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br>\n                <i>optionally</i> <a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('if absent[=0x000A=][=0x000A=]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;if absent\n                </p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase adds the given value to the end of the list. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8368\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8368\"></a>let L be {60, 168};\n                    <br>\n                    add 360 to L;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>results in L being {60, 168, 360}. Note that the value is added even if it already occurs somewhere in L; this can be avoided with &quot;if absent&quot;. So:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8369\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8369\"></a>add 168 to L, if absent;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>would do nothing - it is already there.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc356.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;21.5. 21.5. Building lists</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase (K, list of Ks) -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"

						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra206', 'plus206'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus206\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;add (<span style='color:#4040ff'>value</span>) at entry (<span style='color:#4040ff'>number</span>) in (<span style='color:#4040ff'>list of values</span>)</p>\n<div id=\"extra206\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('add ... at entry ... in')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;add (<span style='color:#4040ff'>value</span>) at entry (<span style='color:#4040ff'>number</span>) in (<span style='color:#4040ff'>list of values</span>)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br>\n                <i>optionally</i> <a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('if absent[=0x000A=][=0x000A=]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;if absent\n                </p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase adds the given value so that it becomes the entry with that index number in the list. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8371\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8371\"></a>let L be {1, 2, 3, 4, 8, 24};\n                    <br>\n                    add 12 at entry 6 in L;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>sets L to {1, 2, 3, 4, 8, 12, 24}. If there are N entries in L, then we can add at any of entries 1 up to N+1: adding at entry N+1 means adding at the end. The phrase option &quot;if absent&quot; makes the phrase do nothing if the value already exists anywhere in L.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc356.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;21.5. 21.5. Building lists</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase (K, number, list of Ks) -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"

						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra208', 'plus208'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus208\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;add (<span style='color:#4040ff'>list of values</span>) at entry (<span style='color:#4040ff'>number</span>) in (<span style='color:#4040ff'>list of values</span>)</p>\n<div id=\"extra208\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('add ... at entry ... in')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;add (<span style='color:#4040ff'>list of values</span>) at entry (<span style='color:#4040ff'>number</span>) in (<span style='color:#4040ff'>list of values</span>)</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase adds the first list to the second so that it begins at the given position. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8372\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8372\"></a>let L be {1, 2, 3, 4};\n                    <br>\n                    add {4, 8, 12} at entry 3 in L;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>results in L being {1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 3, 4}.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc356.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;21.5. 21.5. 						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra209', 'plus209'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus209\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;remove (<span style='color:#4040ff'>value</span>) from (<span style='color:#4040ff'>list of values</span>)</p>\n<div id=\"extra209\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('remove ... from')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;remove (<span style='color:#4040ff'>value</span>) from (<span style='color:#4040ff'>list of values</span>)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br>\n                <i>optionally</i> <a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('if present[=0x000A=][=0x000A=]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;if present\n                </p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase removes every instance of the given value from the list. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8375\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8375\"></a>let L be {3, 1, 4, 1, 5, 9, 2, 6, 5, 3};\n                    <br>\n                    remove 1 from L;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>results in L being {3, 4, 5, 9, 2, 6, 5, 3}. Ordinarily &quot;remove 7 from L&quot; would produce a run-time problem, since L does not contain the value 7, but using the &quot;if present&quot; option lets us off this: the phrase then does nothing if L does not contain the value to be removed.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc356.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;21.5. 21.5. Building lists</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase (K, list of Ks) -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
