						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra210', 'plus210'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus210\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;remove (<span style='color:#4040ff'>list of values</span>) from (<span style='color:#4040ff'>list of values</span>)</p>\n<div id=\"extra210\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('remove ... from')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;remove (<span style='color:#4040ff'>list of values</span>) from (<span style='color:#4040ff'>list of values</span>)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br>\n                <i>optionally</i> <a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('if present[=0x000A=][=0x000A=]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;if present\n                </p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase removes every instance of any value in the first list from the second. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8376\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8376\"></a>let L be {3, 1, 4, 1, 5, 9, 2, 6, 5, 3};\n                    <br>\n                    remove {0, 2, 4, 6, 8} from L;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>results in L being {3, 1, 1, 5, 9, 5, 3}. If both lists are large, this can be a slow process, and we might do better by sorting them and trying a more sophisticated method. But this is convenient for anything reasonable-sized.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc356.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;21.5. 21.5. Building lists</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase (list of Ks, list of Ks) -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"

						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra211', 'plus211'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus211\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;remove entry (<span style='color:#4040ff'>number</span>) from (<span style='color:#4040ff'>list of values</span>)</p>\n<div id=\"extra211\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('remove entry ... from')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;remove entry (<span style='color:#4040ff'>number</span>) from (<span style='color:#4040ff'>list of values</span>)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<br>\n                <i>optionally</i> <a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('if present[=0x000A=][=0x000A=]')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;if present\n                </p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase removes the entry at the given position, counting from 1 as the first entry. (Once it is removed, the other entries shuffle down.) Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8377\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8377\"></a>let L be {3, 1, 4, 1, 5, 9, 2, 6, 5, 3};\n                    <br>\n                    remove entry 3 from L;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>results in L being {3, 1, 1, 5, 9, 2, 6, 5, 3}.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc356.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;21.5. 21.5. Building lists</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase (number, list of values) -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"

(Once they are removed, the other entries shuffle down.) Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8378\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8378\"></a>let L be {3, 1, 4, 1, 5, 9, 2, 6, 5, 3};\n                    <br>\n                    remove entries 3 to 6 from L;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>results in L being {3, 1, 2, 6, 5, 3}.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc356.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;21.5. 21.5. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8499\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8499\"></a>truncate L to 8 entries;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>shortens L to length 8 if it is currently longer than that, trimming entries from the end, but would (for instance) leave a list of length 3 unchanged. Note that</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8500\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8500\"></a>truncate L to 0 entries;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>empties it to { }, the list with nothing in.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc361.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;21.10. 21.10. 						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra220', 'plus220'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus220\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;extend (<span style='color:#4040ff'>list of values</span>) to (<span style='color:#4040ff'>number</span>) entries<span style='color:#808080'>/entry</span></p>\n<div id=\"extra220\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('extend ... to ... entries')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;extend (<span style='color:#4040ff'>list of values</span>) to (<span style='color:#4040ff'>number</span>) entries<span style='color:#808080'>/entry</span></p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase pads out the list with default values as needed so that it now has at least the given length. (If the list is already at least that length, nothing is done.) Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8503\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8503\"></a>extend L to 80 entries;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>lengthens L to length 80 if it is currently shorter than that.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc361.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;21.10. 21.10. Lengthening or shortening a list</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase (list of values, number) -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"
					package phrasebook_entry6 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra221', 'plus221'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus221\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;change (<span style='color:#4040ff'>list of values</span>) to have (<span style='color:#4040ff'>number</span>) entries<span style='color:#808080'>/entry</span></p>\n<div id=\"extra221\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('change ... to have ... entries')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;change (<span style='color:#4040ff'>list of values</span>) to have (<span style='color:#4040ff'>number</span>) entries<span style='color:#808080'>/entry</span></p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase alters the given list so that it now has exactly the number of entries given. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8498\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8498\"></a>change L to have 21 entries;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>If L previously had more than 21 entries, they are thrown away (and lost forever); if L previously had fewer, then new entries are created, using the default value for whatever kind of value L holds. So extending a list of numbers will pad it out with 0s, but extending a list of texts will pad it out with the empty text &quot;&quot;, and so on.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc361.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;21.10. 21.10. Lengthening or shortening a list</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase (list of values, number) -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"

The old entry 1 becomes the new last entry, and so on: reversing an empty list or a list containing only one entry leaves it unchanged. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8429\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8429\"></a>let L be {11, 12, 14, 15, 16, 17};\n                    <br>\n                    reverse L;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>results in L being {17, 16, 15, 14, 12, 11}.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc359.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;21.8. 21.8. Sorting, reversing and rotating lists</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase list of values -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"

Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8435\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8435\"></a>let L be { &quot;cow&quot;, &quot;heifer&quot;, &quot;bullock&quot; };\n                    <br>\n                    rotate L;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>results in L being { &quot;bullock&quot;, &quot;cow&quot;, &quot;heifer&quot; }.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc359.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;21.8. 21.8. Sorting, reversing and rotating lists</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase list of values -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"

Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8436\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8436\"></a>let L be { &quot;cow&quot;, &quot;heifer&quot;, &quot;bullock&quot; };\n                    <br>\n                    rotate L backwards;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>results in L being { &quot;heifer&quot;, &quot;bullock&quot;, &quot;cow&quot;}. (This achieves the same effect as &quot;reverse L; rotate L; reverse L;&quot; but is a little faster, and a lot less effort to read.)</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc359.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;21.8. 21.8. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c4146\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c4146\"></a>next step via the overlooking relation from the Folly to the Chinese Lake\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>The result is the special object value &quot;nothing&quot; if the two endpoints are the same or if no route exists.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc208.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;13.11. 13.11. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c4147\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c4147\"></a>number of steps via the overlooking relation from the Folly to the Chinese Lake\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>The result is 0 if the two endpoints are the same, or -1 if no route exists.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc208.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;13.11. 13.11. 						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra241', 'plus241'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus241\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;(<span style='color:#E00060'>name of kind</span>) that<span style='color:#808080'>/which/who</span> relates to (<span style='color:#4040ff'>value</span>) by (<span style='color:#4040ff'>relation of values</span>) ... <i>value</i></p>\n<div id=\"extra241\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('that relates to ... by')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;(<span style='color:#E00060'>name of kind</span>) that<span style='color:#808080'>/which/who</span> relates to (<span style='color:#4040ff'>value</span>) by (<span style='color:#4040ff'>relation of values</span>) ... <i>value</i></p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase produces an X such that X relates to the given value V by the given relation. Example: suppose partnership relates various texts to various texts. Then we can obtain</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c4204\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c4204\"></a>the text which relates to &quot;cheese&quot; by the partnership relation\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>which might be, say, &quot;chalk&quot;. 					package phrasebook_entry1 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra244', 'plus244'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus244\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;<i>if</i> (<span style='color:#4040ff'>value</span>) matches (<span style='color:#4040ff'>description of values</span>)<i>:</i></p>\n<div id=\"extra244\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('matches')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;<i>if</i> (<span style='color:#4040ff'>value</span>) matches (<span style='color:#4040ff'>description of values</span>)<i>:</i></p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This condition is true if the value matches the description; the kinds must be compatible, or Inform will issue a problem message. There is no point using this for cases where the description is given explicitly:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8657\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8657\"></a>if 4 matches even numbers, ...\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>because it is easier to write just:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8658\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8658\"></a>if 4 is an even number, ...\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>So this condition is only useful when the description is stored in some variable, and its identity is not known.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc364.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;22.2. 22.2. Descriptions as values</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase (K, description of Ks) -> truth state</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"

					package phrasebook_entry8 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra251', 'plus251'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus251\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;apply (<span style='color:#4040ff'>phrase (nothing, nothing) -> nothing</span>) to (<span style='color:#4040ff'>value</span>) and (<span style='color:#4040ff'>value</span>)</p>\n<div id=\"extra251\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('apply ... to ... and')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;apply (<span style='color:#4040ff'>phrase (nothing, nothing) -> nothing</span>) to (<span style='color:#4040ff'>value</span>) and (<span style='color:#4040ff'>value</span>)</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase causes the given phrase to be applied. 						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra253', 'plus253'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus253\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;(<span style='color:#4040ff'>phrase nothing -> value</span>) applied to (<span style='color:#4040ff'>list of values</span>) ... <i>value</i></p>\n<div id=\"extra253\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('applied to')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;(<span style='color:#4040ff'>phrase nothing -> value</span>) applied to (<span style='color:#4040ff'>list of values</span>) ... <i>value</i></p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase takes the list, applies the phrase to each entry in the list, and forms a new list of the result. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8683\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8683\"></a>To decide what number is double (N - a number) (this is doubling):\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;decide on N plus N.\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>Then &quot;doubling applied to 2&quot; produces 4, by the simpler definition of &quot;applied to&quot;, but also:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8684\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8684\"></a>doubling applied to {2, 3, 4}\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>produces the list {4, 6, 8}.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc367.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;22.5. 22.5. Map, filter and reduce</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase (phrase K -> L, list of Ks) -> list of Ls</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"

						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra254', 'plus254'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus254\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;(<span style='color:#4040ff'>phrase (nothing, nothing) -> value</span>) reduction of (<span style='color:#4040ff'>list of values</span>) ... <i>value</i></p>\n<div id=\"extra254\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('reduction of')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;(<span style='color:#4040ff'>phrase (nothing, nothing) -> value</span>) reduction of (<span style='color:#4040ff'>list of values</span>) ... <i>value</i></p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase works through the list and accumulates the values in it, using the phrase supplied. Example: if we have</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8694\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8694\"></a>To decide what number is the sum of (N - number) and (M - number)\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;(this is summing):\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;decide on N + M.\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>then the summing reduction of {3, 8, 4, 19, 7} is the number 41, obtained by</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8695\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8695\"></a>(((3 + 8) + 4) + 19) + 7\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>so that the summing phrase has been used four times.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc367.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;22.5. 22.5. Map, filter and reduce</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase (phrase (K, K) -> K, list of Ks) -> K</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"

						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra255', 'plus255'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus255\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;filter to (<span style='color:#4040ff'>description of values</span>) of (<span style='color:#4040ff'>list of values</span>) ... <i>value</i></p>\n<div id=\"extra255\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('filter to ... of')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;filter to (<span style='color:#4040ff'>description of values</span>) of (<span style='color:#4040ff'>list of values</span>) ... <i>value</i></p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase produces a new list which is a thinner version of the one given, so that it contains only those values which match the description given. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8688\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8688\"></a>filter to even numbers of {3, 8, 4, 19, 7}\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>produces {8, 4}, with the values 3, 19, and 7 failing to make it through. A sufficiently fine filter may well thin out a list to a single entry, or even no entries at all, but the result is always a list.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc367.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;22.5. 22.5. It causes the current rule to end, but without result, so that the activity continues rather than stopping as a result of the rule. This is useful for rulebooks  like the &quot;for&quot; rulebook of an activity) where the default is that a rule does stop the activity.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc291.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;18.5. 18.5. 					package phrasebook_entry2 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra260', 'plus260'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus260\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;begin the (<span style='color:#4040ff'>activity</span>) activity with (<span style='color:#4040ff'>value</span>)</p>\n<div id=\"extra260\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('begin the ... activity with')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;begin the (<span style='color:#4040ff'>activity</span>) activity with (<span style='color:#4040ff'>value</span>)</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase causes the named activity to become active, and runs its &quot;before&quot; rulebook. It can only be used with an activity which has had its &quot;begin&quot; but not yet its &quot;end&quot; phrase; it is a drastic remedy best taken o ly if it is clear that circumstances have changed so that the activity now seems inappropriate. It must not be used during one of the rules for the activity: it can only be used between the begin and for stages, or between the for and end stages.</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c6379\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c6379\"></a>abandon the assaying activity;\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc293.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;18.7. 18.7. If the rule being abided by succeeds or fails then the original rule also stops, at once and without going on to any further i structions. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8016\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8016\"></a>The omnibus rule:\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;abide by the first rule;\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;abide by the second rule;\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;abide by the third rule;\n                    <br>\n                    &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;abide by the fourth rule.\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>This duplicates the effect of a rulebook of four rules: the &quot;omnibus rule&quot; tries each in turn, and stops as soon as any of them stop.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc340.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;19.14. 19.14. 					package phrasebook_entry4 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra279', 'plus279'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus279\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;rule succeeds with result (<span style='color:#4040ff'>value</span>)</p>\n<div id=\"extra279\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('rule succeeds with result')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;rule succeeds with result (<span style='color:#4040ff'>value</span>)</p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This phrase can only be used in a rule which produces a value, and the value given must be of the right kind. It causes the current rule to finish immediately, to succeed, and to produce the value given.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc339.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;19.13. 19.13. Note that files must have been declared, and must be referred to by their Inform names, not by textual filenames. Example:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8736\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8736\"></a>read File of Glaciation Data into the Table of Antarctic Reserves\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>Any rows left spare at the foot of the table are automatically blanked. On the other hand if the file is too large to fit into the table - with too many columns or too many rows - a run-time problem is produced.</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc385.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;23.13. 23.13. Writing and reading tables to external files</p>\n                <p><b>Kind:</b> phrase (external file, table name) -> nothing</p>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/bl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/br_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n    </table>\n    </p>\n</div>\n"

				package phrasebook_heading44 _phrasebook_heading
					constant (text) ^text = "File Handling"
					package phrasebook_entry1 _phrasebook_entry
						constant (text) ^text = "<p class=\"tightin2\"><a href=\"#\" onclick=\"showExtra('extra288', 'plus288'); return false;\"><img border=0 id=\"plus288\" src=inform:/doc_images/extra.png></a>&nbsp;<i>if</i> (<span style='color:#4040ff'>external file</span>) exists<i>:</i></p>\n<div id=\"extra288\" style=\"display: none;\">\n    <p class=\"in3\"><table width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"background-color: #e0e0e0\">\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tl_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n            <td>\n\n            </td>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n                <img src=\"inform:/bg_images/tr_corner_e0e0e0.gif\" width=\"8\" height=\"8\" border=\"0\" alt=\"...\">\n            </td>\n        </tr>\n        <tr>\n            <td width=\"8\">\n\n            </td>\n            <td>\n                <p><a href=\"javascript:pasteCode('exists')\"><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/paste.png></a>&nbsp;<i>if</i> (<span style='color:#4040ff'>external file</span>) exists<i>:</i></p>\n\n\n                    <p>    This condition is true if the file-system used by the player appears to contain a file with the right name. For example, if we declared:</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8737\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8737\"></a>The binary File of Glaciation Data is called &quot;icedata&quot;.\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>and then tested</p>\n                    <!--START CODE \"c8738\"-->\n                    <blockquote class=\"code\"><p class=\"quoted\"><a id=\"c8738\"></a>if the File of Glaciation Data exists, ...\n                    </p>\n                    </blockquote>\n                    <!--END CODE-->\n                    <p>then Inform would search for a file called &quot;icedata&quot;. (The arrangements for where this might be stored, and its filename extension, vary from platform to platform.)</p>\n\n                <p><b>See</b> &nbsp;<a href=inform:/doc385.html><img border=0 src=inform:/doc_images/help.png></a>&nbsp;23.13. 23.13. 					local n
					local val
					code
						inv !ifelse
							inv !eq
								val to_entry_size
								val from_entry_size
							code
								inv /main/BasicInformKit/functions/Memcpy_fn/Memcpy
									val to_array
									val from_array
									inv !times
										val to_entry_size
										val no_entries
							code
								inv !ifelse
									inv !and
										inv !eq
											val to_entry_size
											val 2
										inv !eq
											val from_entry_size
											val 4
									code
										inv !for
											inv !store
												reference
													val n
												val 0
											inv !lt
												val n
												val no_entries
											inv !postincrement

													val n
											code

													reference

						inv !return

							val parameter
							code

							reference

									val 0

			package BlkValueCompare_fn _function
				package BlkValueCompare _code
					local bv_left
					local bv_right
					local kind_left
					local kind_right
					local kovs
					code
						inv !if
							inv !and
								inv !eq
									val bv_left
									val 0
								inv !eq
									val bv_right
									val 0
							code
								inv !return
									val 0
						inv !if
							inv !eq
								val bv_left
								val 0
							code
								inv !return
									val 1
						inv !if
							inv !eq
								val bv_right
								val 0
							code
								inv !return
									inv !unaryminus
										val 1

			package TEXT_TY_CHR_CompileTree_fn _function
				package TEXT_TY_CHR_CompileTree _code
					local ftxt
					local exactly
					local root
					local literal
					local fto

			package TEXT_TY_RE_SeekBacktrack_fn _function
				package TEXT_TY_RE_SeekBacktrack _code
					local token
					local ftxt
					local downwards
					local ito
					local report_only
					local untried
					code
						inv !for
							val 1
							inv !ne
								val token
								val /main/architectural/NULL
							inv !store
								reference
									val token
								inv !lookup
									val token
									val /main/BasicInformKit/constants/RE_NEXT_con/RE_NEXT
							code

									inv !and

										inv !eq
											val report_only
											val 0
									code
										inv !print
											val "Scan for rewind: "
										inv /main/BasicInformKit/functions/TEXT_TY_RE_DebugNode_fn/TEXT_TY_RE_DebugNode
											val token
											val ftxt
											val 1

									inv !and

			package DoubleHashSetLookUp_fn _function
				package DoubleHashSetLookUp _code
					local rel
					local kx
					local ky
					local X
					local Y
					local hashv
					local i
					local free
					local mask
					local perturb
					local flags
					code
						inv !store
							reference
								val hashv
							inv !plus
								inv /main/BasicInformKit/functions/GetHashValue_fn/GetHashValue
									val kx
									val X
								inv /main/BasicInformKit/functions/GetHashValue_fn/GetHashValue
									val ky
									val Y
						inv !store
							reference
								val mask
							inv /main/BasicInformKit/functions/BlkValueRead_fn/BlkValueRead
								val rel
								val /main/BasicInformKit/constants/RRV_STORAGE_con/RRV_STORAGE
						inv !store
							reference
								val i
							inv !bitwiseand
								val hashv
								val mask
						inv !store
							reference
								val flags
							inv /main/BasicInformKit/functions/BlkValueRead_fn/BlkValueRead
								val rel
								inv !plus
									val /main/BasicInformKit/constants/RRV_DATA_BASE_con/RRV_DATA_BASE
									inv !times
										val 3
										val i
						inv !if
							inv !eq
								val flags
								val 0
							code
								inv !return
									inv !bitwisenot

			package RelationRouteTo_fn _function

			package RunTimeProblem_fn _function
				package RunTimeProblem _code
					local n
					local par1
					local par2
					local par3
					local ln
					local file
					code
						inv !if
							inv !eq
								inv !lookup
									val /main/BasicInformKit/arrays/RTP_Buffer_arr/RTP_Buffer

								val -1

									reference

									reference

									reference

									reference

									val file
						inv /main/BasicInformKit/functions/RunTimeProblemShow_fn/RunTimeProblemShow

			package RunTimeProblemShow_fn _function
				package RunTimeProblemShow _code
					local n
					local par1
					local par2
					local par3
					local ln
					local file
					local i
					local c
					code
						inv !if
							inv !eq
								inv !lookup
									val /main/BasicInformKit/arrays/RTP_Buffer_arr/RTP_Buffer
									val 0
								inv !alternative
									val -1
									val -2
							code
								inv !return
									val 1
						inv !if
							inv !lookup
								val /main/BasicInformKit/arrays/RTP_Buffer_arr/RTP_Buffer
								val 6
							code
								inv !return
									val 1
						inv !store
							reference
								val n
							inv !lookup
								val /main/BasicInformKit/arrays/RTP_Buffer_arr/RTP_Buffer
								val 0
						inv !store
							reference
								val par1
							inv !lookup
								val /main/BasicInformKit/arrays/RTP_Buffer_arr/RTP_Buffer
								val 1
						inv !store
							reference
								val par2
							inv !lookup
								val /main/BasicInformKit/arrays/RTP_Buffer_arr/RTP_Buffer
								val 2
						inv !store
							reference
								val par3
							inv !lookup
								val /main/BasicInformKit/arrays/RTP_Buffer_arr/RTP_Buffer
								val 3
						inv !store
							reference
								val ln
							inv !lookup
								val /main/BasicInformKit/arrays/RTP_Buffer_arr/RTP_Buffer
								val 4
						inv !store
							reference
								val file
							inv !lookup
								val /main/BasicInformKit/arrays/RTP_Buffer_arr/RTP_Buffer
								val 5
						inv !store
							reference
								inv !lookup
									val /main/BasicInformKit/arrays/RTP_Buffer_arr/RTP_Buffer
									val 0
							val -2
						inv !print
							val "\n"
						inv !print
							val "*** Run-time problem P"
						inv !printnumber
							val n
						inv !if
							val ln
							code
								inv !print
									val " (at paragraph "
								inv !printnumber
									val ln
								inv !print
									val " in "
								inv !ifelse
									inv !eq
										val file
										val 0
									code
										inv !print
											val "the source text"
									code
										inv /main/synoptic/extensions/showoneextension_fn/call
											val file
								inv !print
									val ")"
						inv !print
							val ": "
						inv !switch
							val n
							code
								inv !case
									val /main/BasicInformKit/constants/RTP_IMPREL_con/RTP_IMPREL
									code
										inv !print
											val "Tried to access an inappropriate relation for "
										inv /main/BasicInformExtrasKit/functions/DefArt_fn/DefArt
											val par1
										inv !print
											val ", violating '"
										inv !printstring
											inv /main/BasicInformKit/functions/RlnGetF_fn/RlnGetF
												val par2
												val /main/BasicInformKit/constants/RR_DESCRIPTION_con/RR_DESCRIPTION
										inv !print
											val "'.\n"
								inv !case
									val /main/BasicInformKit/constants/RTP_TOOMANYRULEBOOKS_con/RTP_TOOMANYRULEBOOKS
									code
										inv !print
											val "Too many rulebooks in simultaneous use.\n"
								inv !case
									val /main/BasicInformKit/constants/RTP_BADPROPERTY_con/RTP_BADPROPERTY
									code
										inv !print
											val "Tried to access non-existent property for "
										inv /main/BasicInformExtrasKit/functions/DefArt_fn/DefArt
											val par1
										inv !print
											val ".\n"

									val /main/BasicInformKit/constants/RTP_UNPROVIDED_con/RTP_UNPROVIDED
									code
										inv !print
											val "Since "
										inv /main/BasicInformExtrasKit/functions/DefArt_fn/DefArt
											val par1

				package RunTimeError _code

					local p1
